Catalina es la presidenta, y cuenta que ayuda a sus compañeras en todo lo que puede para poder salir adelante y dejar la pobreza atrás. Catalina tiene una pequeña, pero surtida despensa donde trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. Gracias a su sacrificio está saliendo adelante y también ayuda a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con enlatados, bebidas, panificados, verduras, etc, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y surtiendo su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Ciudad Nueva neighborhood of the city of Caaguazú, as a result of some promotions that were made in the neighborhood, a group of women interested in participating in the Enterprising Women program of the Fundacion Paraguaya formed a communal bank.  The group consists of 21 hardworking and enterprising women.  At this time, they are in their 12th loan cycle.  

Catalina is the president, and she says that she helps her fellow group members in every way she can so that they can get ahead and leave poverty behind them.  Catalina has a small, but well-stocked, store where she works every day from the early hours of the morning.  Thanks to her sacrifice, she is getting ahead and also helping her family.

She is requesting a loan to stock up her business with canned goods, beverages, bread, vegetables, etc.  This way, she will be able to continue working and can continue to keep her store well-stocked.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, bread, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Upatanisho Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira  est entrepreneur, leader du collectif d’affaire Upatanisho, âgée d’environ 48 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants dont certains ont leurs propres foyers et  d’autres vont encore à l’école. Son mari est chômeur. La  cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme et l’huile végétal raffiné Rina. Elle expose ses marchandises au long de la rue et parfois à son domicile. Il y a 7 ans révolus, elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds de crédit reçu de l’IMF Hekima vers 2004. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (6 bidons d’huile de palme et 4 cartons d’huile végétal raffiné Rina, 2 sacs de farines, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et construire dignement une belle maison pour  sa famille. Selon elle, le crédit de Hekima lui a servi  de vivre dans des conditions de vie  socialement  acceptables. La cliente salut l’initiative de l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client Kavira is an entrepreneur, leader of the business group Upatanisho, approximately 48 years old, married, and mother to 9 children of whom some have their own homes and others still go to school. Her husband is unemployed. The client sells palm oil and the refined vegetable oil Rina. She displays her merchandise along her street and sometimes at her home. She has been practicing this business for 7 years. 

She started her business with funds from a loan received from the Hekima MFI around 2004. This new loan will serve to stock up in new merchandise (6 cans of palm oil and 4 cartons of the refined vegetable oil Rina, 2 bags of flour, etc.) In addition, she aims to expand her business and fittingly build a beautiful house for her family. According to her, the loan from Hekima helped her to live in socially acceptable living conditions. The client salutes the initiative of the Hekima MFI for its actions dedicated to the poor women excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise (6 cans of palm oil and 4 cartons of the refined vegetable oil Rina, 2 bags of flour, etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Loreta's Group

texts.en: Loreta is 45 years old and lives in Paglaum Dumalinao ZDS. She is married, the mother of three children and earns a living by selling pants, T-shirts, and many other personal items. She has had this business for four years and is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more clothes to sell to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for four years and hopes to have her own store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for a ready-to-wear business

loans.name: Jonnalyn

texts.en:
This is Jonnalyn. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy cellular phone load credits from different local networks. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy cellular phone load credits from different local networks. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and child's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jonnalyn dream is to secure her child’s education and hopes to have a beautiful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cellular phone credits needed for her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 44 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She earns a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store in her village where she sells soft drinks, sugar, oil, coffee and vinegar. She is very committed to her business because it has been a great help in improving her family's living conditions and, most especially, in paying for her children’s education. As they grow older, her children's needs are increasing so she is committed to doubling her efforts to earn a good income. She is requesting a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy soft drinks, rice, and bread to sell to her customers. She hopes to use this loan to increase her profits and provide a good living to her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, and bread to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ruth Susana

texts.es: Ruth de 35 años de edad, es responsable y trabajadora quien cuenta con muchos deseos de salir adelante y contar con una mejor vida. Vive junto a su esposo y su madre a quien ayuda y provee de todo lo necesario. Ruth posee una tienda de productos comestibles, de uso para el hogar y uso personal, entre otros más, su negocio es muy estable dejándole ganancias aceptables. A pesar de esto Ruth desea mejorar esas ganancias invirtiendo en la tienda y comprando mayor cantidad de productos de primera necesidad como sopas instantáneas, detergentes, leche, bebidas y muchos más, de forma que pueda atender a más personas  y así mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Ruth, age 35, is responsible and hardworking. She has the drive to succeed in order to have a better life. Ruth lives with her husband and her mother who she helps and provides everything that she needs.

Ruth has a store where she sells food, household goods, personal use products, and other items. Her business is very stable and generates acceptable income. Despite this, Ruth wants to improve the earnings from her store and purchase large quantities of basic necessities such as instant soups, detergents, milk, beverages, and other items. This will enable her to serve more people and improve her finances.

loans.use: to buy instant soups, detergents, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Del Campo Group

texts.es:
DÚO MUJERES DEL CAMPO
Este dúo lo forma doña Wendy Roció, quien es madre de familia, tiene 1 hijo y se dedica a la elaboración de pan los días lunes y jueves en la panadería y solicita este crédito para comprar algunos materiales para la elaboración del pan como( leña, harina y azúcar) que es lo que más se necesita, ella mantiene 2 ocupaciones una como maestra en la mañana pero lo que gana no es suficiente para sostenerse y también se dedica a elaboracion y a vender pan, está entusiasmada porque cree que con el apoyo de fape ella va a poder seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
DÚO MUJERES DEL CAMPO [Countryside women duo]

This duo is composed of doña Wendy Rocío, who is a house wife and has a son and makes bread on Mondays and Thursdays at the bakery.

She is requesting this loan to buy some materials for making bread, such as firewood, flour and sugar, which is what is needed the most. She has two jobs; one as a teacher in the morning, but she does not earn enough in order to support herself; and she also makes and sells bread.

She feels very enthusiastic, because she believes that with FAPE's support, she will be able to get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood, flour and sugar to make bread.

loans.name: Solidario Sara Y Alma Group

texts.es:
CREDITO NUEVO SOLIDARIO SARA Y ALMA
Doña Alma Leticia, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en general, a la venta de ponchos mexicanos en diferentes tamaños y precios, Ella nos cuenta que tiene varios pedidos de mercaderia ya varias vecinas la han visitado para encargarles su producto  Ella tiene  su capital pero no le alcanza para poder cubrir todos los pedidos que le han hecho  también le han pedido ollas por vajilla pero tampoco le alcanza el dinero para comprarlo.  Por eso ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo préstamo  para poder hacer estos pedidos y no fallarles a sus clientes para que no se alejen.
texts.en:
Solidario Sara y Alma's New Loan

Alma Leticia sells cosmetics and Mexican ponchos in different sizes and prices. She tells us that she has had several orders for merchandise and that many of her neighbours have come to her to order her products.
	
She has capital, but it is not enough to cover all the orders she has. Her customers have also ordered crockery pots, but she does not have the necessary funds to buy them.
	
Due to this, she needs to request a new loan so she can make these orders and not fail her customers, so they will not leave.

loans.use: Para la Compra de Productos de usos Domesticos.

loans.name: Harmony Center Group

texts.en:
Raymunda is married with five children. She is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Raymunda is a farmer and grows rice and corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for her agricultural land.

Raymunda has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for three years. In the future, Raymunda hopes to supply rice and corn to all the people here in the Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her agricultural land

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 49 years old, married, and blessed with five children. Three of them are in elementary school while two are in high school. To continue sending them to school and to support their needs, she engaged herself in the buying and selling of bananas in the community. She is asking for financial support to add up her capital. A loan amount of PHP 5,000 would be a great help in the purchase of additional bananas to sell. She hopes for her loan approval.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to sell

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Luis tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Don Luis tiene un taller de ebanistería desde hace dos años, lo tiene instalado en su casa y su actividad es la fabricación de muebles de madera como ser cunas,  mesas de varios diseños, muebles de cocina, mueble de comedor y muebles tallados como cortineros, puertas y otros. El anteriormente trabajo en un negocio de artesanos y allí aprendió a hacer trabajos de tallado. El está solicitando su primer préstamo con ODEF, el cual es por 22,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de una maquina canteadora para su negocio. Con esta inversión espera mejorar sus trabajos y poder aumentar las ventas. Su plan es aprovechar la oportunidad brindada del financiamiento para crecer en su negocio y en un futuro poder comprar un terreno para ubicar el negocio separado de su casa.
texts.en:
Luis, age 47, lives with his wife and three children in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  Luis has had a cabinetmaking shop at his house for two years.  He makes wood furniture like cradles, different designs of tables, kitchen furniture, dining room furniture, and carved furniture like curtain hangers, doors, and others.  He previously worked at a handicraft business, and that is where he learned to make his carved works.

This is the first time he has requested a loan with ODEF, which is for 22,000 lempiras.  He will use it to buy an edging machine for his business.  With this investment he hopes to improve his work and be able to increase sales.  His plan is to take advantage of the opportunity of the loan in order to grow in his business.  In the future he hopes to be able to buy a piece of land to locate his business separate from his house.

loans.use: to buy an edging machine to do woodwork in his business.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
Doña María Inés  es una microempresaria emprendedora que se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos de la Avon y los comercializa en su comunidad.
Esta actividad la ha venido realizando desde hace 8 años y de esta forma a sacado adelante a su familia.
Este nuevo crédito lo utilizara para compra de cosmeticos de la Avon como perfume, colonia de varon y mujer, crema para manos y cuerpos.
texts.en: Maria Ines is a micro-entrepreneur that works selling Avon cosmetics in her community.  She has done this for 8 years and has been able to get her family ahead.  This new loan will be used to purchase Avon cosmetics such as perfume, men's cologne, as well as hand and body lotion.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for sale such as perfume, body lotion, hand lotion, etc.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is 53 years old, widowed and has five children, the youngest living with her. To earn a living, she sells second-hand dresses in the market. Her youngest child is still studying, so to send her to school, Josie is doing her best to make a good income. The desire to increase her usual income has prompted her to seek a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy used clothes, shoes, sandals and bags. She hopes that this loan will be a big help in increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy used clothes, shoes, sandals and bags

loans.name: Morning Glory Group

texts.en:
Lolita, 60, is widowed, has five children and lives in the Philippines.
                            
Lolita is a farmer and, for 10 years, has grown corn to earn a living. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seed.           

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Lolita hopes to harvest more corn crops.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 38 years old and married. She is from Gabunon, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She has two grown children who help her take care of their farm where they grow bananas and coconuts. They been farming for four years and earn 15,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Mary Jane joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and to pay for weeding. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for weeding

loans.name: Felomino

texts.en: Felomino, 60, is a widower. He is a very responsible father, living with his two children. He has a piggery business as his source of income. He is also a farmer. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and medicine for his hogs. He is sure this will make a big difference in his ability to earn an income, which will improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for his hogs

loans.name: Cira

texts.es: La Sra. Cira sigue con la misma actividad de venta de ropa segun a la temporada le fue muy bien con el anterior credito, por este motivo esta solicitando otro credito para la compra de poleras y pantalones ya que comenzo la epoca de calor y tiene mucha demanda para estos productos.
texts.en: Mrs. Cira continues selling seasonal clothes. She did very well with the previous loan. This is why she is requesting another loan to buy t-shirts and pants, because the warm season has started and the demand for these products increases.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts and pants.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is 44 years old and engaged in buying and selling bananas. Her husband works as a farmer. They are helping each other to improve their living condition. The couple is blessed with two children and both go to school. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more sacks of bananas to sell at a profitable price. Nilda is hoping for immediate success through the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of bananas.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en: Maximo, 55, is married, has two children and resides in Lower Usugan, Bonifacio. Maximo has operated a farming venture, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community, for five years. Each month, he earns 25,000 PHP from his business. He requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. In 2011, Maximo joined GDMPC. In the future, Maximo wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, 44, is a very industrious woman who is a fruit and vegetable vendor in her community. She offers door-to-door service to sell to her villagers. Sometimes, she just earns 200 PHP daily so she wants to pursue selling in other communities without hesitating to walk a distance. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy additional goods to sell such as eggplant and bananas. She hopes this will generate more income every day so she could provide a better living for her family

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell such eggplant and bananas.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
This is Amelia. She previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help to support her personal, household, and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Amelia hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to manufacture a roof for the front of his house.

loans.name: Gioconda María

texts.es:
En el barrio monimbo, del departamento de Masaya vive la Señora Gioconda, ella es comerciante, tiene la edad de 28 años, casada;comenta que a raíz que la situación económica del país esta mal, tomo la iniciativa de echar a andar su propio negocio, el cual consiste en venta de leña, el cual este se utiliza para elaborar el alimento  diario de las familias en su sector y también se ayuda vendiento frijoles cosidos,  diario desde la mañana ella enciende el  fogón para coser el frijoles y durante el dia tambien vende la leña, todo lo vende los mismos vecinos el cual ya son clientes fijos.

Gioconda se presenta a nuestra oficina Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito en el que pueda comprar la mercadería  que necesita: leña de madera, acetuna, de mamon y leña sin rajar, y un quintal de frijoles  (para coser), de tal manera que le ayudara en sus ventas, mayores ingresos, que le permitirá dar una mejor condición de vida a su hogar.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Monimbo, located in the Masaya department, lives Mrs. Gioconda. She is a saleswoman, 28 years old and married. She mentions that because of the bad economic situation in the country, she started her own business, which consists of selling wood, used by families in the area to prepare their everyday food. She also sells cooked beans, as an additional contribution. Every morning she starts the fire in order to cook the beans and during the day she also sells firewood. Her neighbors are now regular customers.

Gioconda comes to CEPRODEL's offices to request a loan with which she can buy the merchandise she needs: firewood, olive tree wood, mamoncillo tree wood and unchopped wood and a quintal of beans (for cooking). In this way, she will have better income from her sales, with which she will be able to provide a better life condition at home.

loans.use: to buy firewood of different types and beans for selling.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel de 39 años de edad tiene su negocio en el centro de la ciudad en una zona muy comercial; él se dedica a la compra y venta de sacos, una bolsa tejida en fique o en tiras sintéticas, que tiene mucha funcionalidad cunado se trata de empacar. Desde que fue desplazado por  la violencia, llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla, con el propósito de generar ingresos suficientes,  para atender las necesidades de su familia  y así fue como emprendió su propia aventura de negocios, en la que hoy maneja un volumen de ventas mayor de 5000 unidades semanales. Desde hace 15 años cuando inició su negocio compra a recicladores que llevan los sacos a sus instalaciones, para que Manuel  los venda  principalmente a 2 comercializadoras que empacan sal en el municipio de Manaure, departamento de la Guajira, donde el El mar es la materia prima para la industria de la sal, base de la economía del municipio, que produce la mayoría de la sal consumida en Colombia.  En la actualidad su meta es aumentar su capacidad de compra, para proveer a  muchos más clientes, a quienes aun no han logrado llegar, porque para ello su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará en un mayor volumen sacos en sintético, con lo que espera ganar un poco mas de dinero, que beneficie  aun mas, el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 39 years old and owns a business in the center of the city, in a very commercial area. He buys and sells sacks, a type of bag that can be made out of fique or synthetic thread. It is very useful for packing.

He came to Barranquilla, forced by the violence in the countryside. Looking to make enough to support his family's needs, he started his own venture. He is now selling more than 5000 sacks per week.

15 years ago, he started his business. He buys sacks from people that collect recyclable waste and bring them to his establishment. Manuel sells them mainly to two distributors that pack salt in the Manaure municipality, in the Guajira department. Here, the sea is the raw material of the salt industry, which is the base for the municipality's economy. The majority of the salt consumed in Colombia is produced here.

His goal is now to increase his capacity to buy, in order to supply even more customers. His working capital is insufficient to reach more customers. This is why he is requesting a credikiva, with which he will buy a larger amount of synthetic sacks. He hopes to make a bit more money in this way, which will benefit, even more, his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy synthetic bags in bulk.

loans.name: El Mirador Group

texts.es:
Mario Alejandro es el secretario del grupo “El Mirador” (en el video es el primero del lado izquierdo, que se presenta a los inversionistas Kiva), un grupo integrado por seis socios todos trabajadores y con muchas ganas de progresar.
Mario tiene 23 años, es soltero y estudia administración de negocios en la universidad.
Como es un joven muy emprendedor, Mario tenía muchas ganas de empezar su propio negocio. Así que, después de investigar la rentabilidad y demanda de algunos negocios, se decidió a empezar un negocio de lencería. Él compra los productos en un mercado mayorista y véndelos en su propia tienda. Solo empezó hace una semana pero está muy animado y creé que con este negocio va a conseguir ingresos suficientes para financiar sus estudios.
Mario invertirá el préstamo en la compra de productos de lencería para su negocio como medias, calcetines, mallas, ropa interior, etc.
El mayo sueño de Mario es terminar sus estudios en administración y tener un buen hogar y una buena familia. El pide a los inversionistas Kiva que apoyen a su negocio y a los negocios de otras personan que tengan ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mario Alejandro is secretary of the "El Mirador” group (in the video being shown to the Kiva lenders, he is first on the left). It is a group made up of six members; all hard-working with a strong desire to progress. 

Mario is 23, single, and studies business administration at university. 

As he is a very enterprising young man, Mario is very eager to start his own business. So, after investigating the profitability and demand for a few businesses, he made up his mind to start a lingerie business. 

He buys the products in the wholesale market and sells them in his own store. He only began a week ago, but is highly motivated and believes that with this business he is going to get enough income to finance his studies. 

Mario will use the loan to buy lingerie products for his business, such as stockings, socks, tights, underwear, etc. 

Mario's greatest dream is to complete his studies in business administration and to have a good home and a good family. He asks the Kiva investors to support his business and the businesses of other people who have the desire to succeed.

video.title: Kiva Borrower MARIO ALEJANDRO from Peru

loans.use: To buy lingerie items.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos, se dedica a la agricultura, vive con su esposa, tiene dos hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de él, la siembra agrícola la realiza en dos manzanas del terreno las cuales sirven para el alimento de su familia y para comercializar una parte, generando así dinero para cubrir otras necesidades, también se dedica a la pesca artesanal de la cual logra realizar algunas ventas y para el consumo familiar.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos ya que se encuentra realizando la siembra de maíz y debe aplicar lo necesario como lo es el abono, este préstamo ayudará a que tenga una mejor producción de maíz.

Uno de los objetivos que Carlos es ayudar a su familia a mejorar la calidad de vida con el esfuerzo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos works in agriculture, lives with his wife and has two children, who depend financially on him. With his produce from planting in two blocks of terrain, he feeds his family. By commercializing a part of his production, he is able to generate some income to cover other necessities. He also works as a fisher, sells a portion of what he fishes, and uses the rest for the consumption of his household. 

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies. He is currently planting corn, and in order to have a better production, he requires fertilizer amongst other supplies. 

Carlo’s objective is to be able to improve the quality of live of his family through his efforts in his work.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Azucenas Blanca Group

texts.es:
Grupo formado por tres microempresaria emprendedoras, doña Rosaura se dedica a la comercialización de artesanía además elabora bisuterías como cadenas, aretes y los vende en el centro turistico en el mirador, actividad que realiza desde 9 años.
El crédito lo invertirá en un nuevo rubro como es la venta de pollo de esta manera está diversificando su negocio.
Doña Ruth se dedica a vender pollo en piezas en su domicilio, doña Issel comercializa ropa usada.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 3 micro-entrepreneurs. Rosaura has 9 years of experience selling crafts and makes imitation jewelry such as necklaces and earrings, to sell at the tourist center at the lookout.   

She will invest this loan in a new area by selling chicken in order to diversify her income.  

Ruth sells cut up chicken from her home, and Issel sells used clothing.

loans.use: to purchase vases, wall decorations, pots, necklaces, and earrings etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a cement floor for her café and offer a wider variety of products to her clients.

loans.name: Mery Jane

texts.es:
Mery, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, casada, madre de tres hijos de 12, 8 y 2 años de edad. Además de ser ama de casa, se dedica a vender zapatos y perfumes. Esta idea surgió como una forma de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del  hogar y la manutención de sus tres hijos. Su esposo le dio un pequeño capital y una tía le ayudo a conseguir clientes,  vende a domicilio mientras sus hijos están en la escuela sale a vender en busca de clientes.  
Tiene pedidos de zapatos y necesita comprar al por mayor que es para lo cual usara el crédito. Además de vendar sandalias y perfumes. Su idea a futuro es vender una línea de zapatos deportivos, que son muy  populares entre los jóvenes.
texts.en:
Mery lives in the city of Granada. She is married and has three children, 12, 8 and 2 years old. Besides being a housewife, she sells shoes and perfumes. This idea was born as a way to help her husband with the expenses at home and with their children's support. Her husband gave her a small capital and an aunt helped her find some customers. She sells door-to-door. While her children attend school, she goes out looking for customers.

Her customers have ordered some shoes and she needs to buy them in bulk. This is what she will use the credit for. She also sells sandals and perfumes. Her idea is to sell sport shoes in the future, because they are very popular among young people.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 35 años, tiene 5 hijos que son de las edades de 16, 14, 11, 8 Y 6 años, todos s encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de cereales embolsados como   arrocitos, fideos y granola de trigo en bolsitas en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona de Tacagua,  Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Sra. Maria utilizara este préstamo para la compra de mercadería (por mayor y surtir sus productos) para su negocio,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la Sra. Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, y va a utilizar los beneficios En mejorar su vida a través de la prosperidad.
texts.en: María, 35, has five children whose ages are 16, 14, 11, 8 and 6 years; all are school age.  She sells packaged cereals like rice, noodles and wheat granola in little bags from her stand located in the Tacagua zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and María will use it to buy merchandise at wholesale and to stock up on products for her business.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her merchandise.  The business challenge María faces is competition and she will use profits to improve her life by means of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma operates a hog fattening business as a source of income. After four to five months, she disposes of her hogs at a profitable price. She is 36 years of age and has been dedicating herself in this business for over three years. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and cement for building a better shelter for her hogs. This will make her hogs healthier and will provide her a higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs and cement for building a better shelter

loans.name: Peggy

texts.en:
Peggy is 37 years old and lives in P7 Polao, Tangub City. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Peggy has a small restaurant. She earns about PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. Peggy has requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her small restaurant.

Peggy has been a member of PMPC for  two months.  In the future, Peggy would like to have not just a "carinderia" (food stall) as a source of income.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her small restaurant

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old and lives in Tonggo, Tudela. She is married with four children. 

To earn a living, Rosa has a "carenderia" (cooked food stall) business selling foods in the local community. Rosa earns about PHP 7000 each month doing this type of work. Rosa has requested a loan to purchase additional spices and ingredients such as garlic, onions, iodized salt, etc.

Rosa has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Rosa would like to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices and ingredients such as garlic, onions, iodized salt, etc.

loans.name: Leoma

texts.en: Leoma, married, is 32 years old and lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living she sells phone accessories. She loves fashion and new trends, and that entices her to engage in such activity. She has been operating this site for three years and earns PHP 10,000 each month. She has requested a loan for PHP 25,000 from GDMPC to obtain more phone accessories to sell. Leoma is a new member of the cooperative. In the future, she hopes to be more progressive in this venture.

loans.use: to obtain more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: La Sra. Alejandra tiene 59 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son ya son mayores, ella quiere abrir un negocio que es una carnicería  en la zona 3 de Mayo, sabe ya de esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Alejandra va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una maquina cortadora de carne por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para la compra de esta máquina cortadora para carnicería ya que es una herramienta muy necesaria, la Sra. Alejandra enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria ya que en la zona existen varias carnicerías  y  va a utilizar los beneficios para la compra de distintas herramientas para seguir implementando su negocio.
texts.en: Alejandra, 59, is married and has two children who are adults now.  She wants to open a butcher shop in the 3 de Mayo neighborhood.  She’s had experience in this line of work for some time now.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Alejandra will use the loan to buy a machine to cut meat for her business.  Her reason for requesting this loan is the lack of cash to buy the machine to cut meat for her butcher shop; it’s a very necessary tool.  The business challenge Alejandra faces is daily competition because there are several butcher shops in the zone.  She will use profits to buy the various tools needed to continue equipping her business.

loans.use: to buy a meat saw.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 43 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Upper Centro,Tudela. Eliza has a dress shop, which she has run for 16 years. 

Eliza is request a loan, which she will use to purchase additional clothing materials.  She has been a member of PMPC for seven months.  In the future, Eliza hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials.

loans.name: Lilebeth

texts.en:
Lilebeth is  married having three children. She is 35 years old, residing at Bonifacio. Lilebeth owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been 11 years in this business. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. 

In 2011, Lilebeth joined GDMPC. In the future, Lilebeth wants to build a house and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
This is Sabina. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy raw materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Sabina dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through her hard work on her business and she also hopes to reach more customers in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
This is Elvie.  She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in larger profits. Her profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Elvie  hopes to be able to expand soon, and dreams of giving a good future to her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, when she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Kirk

texts.en:
Kirk is 39 years old and lives in San Nicolas, Tudela. He is married with three children. He has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 3000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to purchase additional housing materials.

Kirk has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, he hopes to earn for his family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional housing materials

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is widowed and has six children. She is 55 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. Nenita is a farmer and grows rice and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Nenita has requested a loan to purchase additional inorganic and commercial fertilizers.
 
Nenita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to financially support her immediate family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
This is Cristita, She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Cristita hopes her business will expand and that her children will have a good quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
This is Leona, She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional supplies of pork and beef meat. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of pork and beef meat. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Leona hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of meat needed in her business.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, habita en la ciudad de Granada, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a vender ropa y zapatos, lleva 5 años en esta actividad. Anteriormente trabajaba como domestica pero tomo la decisión de emprender con algo propio que le permitiera mejorar su situación económica, sus hijos han sido su apoyo fundamental. Inicio  vendiendo ropa usada al pasar el tiempo  consiguió más clientes, con las ganancias obtenidas invirtió en ropa nueva y zapatos para vender.  Sale desde tempranas horas de la mañana y regresa por las tardes después de una día intenso de trabajo caminando y buscan como colocar su mercadería. En  lo futuro le gustaría tener una tienda grande de ropa y zapatos. 
La época de navidad está cerca y necesita tener inventario para vender por eso solicita el crédito para  comprar jean, camisetas, blusas, faldas de vestir, sandalias. Las ventas son buenas durante esta época para sector de la ropa y calzado y no quiere perder la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sonia is a single mother of two children and lives in the city of Granada. She has been working as a seller of clothing and shoes for the past five years. Previously, she worked in domestic service but decided to work independently in order to improve her financial situation. Her children have provided her with fundamental support. She started selling used clothing, managed to get more clients with time and was able to invest her profits in new clothing and shoes to sell. 

She heads out to work every morning and comes back in the afternoon after an intense day of work, in which she has to walk and figure a way to exhibit her merchandise. In the future she would like to have a large shop of clothing and shoes. 
Since the Christmas season is approaching, she needs to have inventory to sell and this is why she is requesting a loan to purchase jeans, tee shirts, blouses, skirts and sandals. The sales during this season are really good for the clothing and shoes sectors, and she does not want to loose the chance to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, tee shirts, blouses, skirts and sandals.

loans.name: Merlyn Nadieska

texts.es:
Merlyn tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Tiene tres años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de comida, antes solo se dedicaba a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa. Los insumos para elaborar la comida los adquiere diariamente, para ofrecer siempre un producto fresco a sus clientes. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación a Campo, es para adquirir más mercadería para vender en su cafetín. Con el objetivo de diversificar sus productos, para atraer a más clientes y proporcionar un mejor servicio. Su propósito es continuar trabajando en su negocio para ampliarlo y seguir satisfaciendo a su clientes.
texts.en:
Merlyn is 24 years old, single and has two children. For the past three years, she has worked in the preparation and sale of food. Previously, she only did domestic chores. She acquires the inputs required for the preparation of the food daily, in order to be able to offer a fresh product to her clients. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase more merchandise to offer in her café. Her objective is to be able to diversify the products she offers to attract more clients and to offer them a better service. Her purpose is to continue working in her business in order to make it grow and to continue satisfying her clients.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her café.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijas. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la elaboración de: enchiladas, tostadas de plátanos y de yuca, nuégados y chilate. Estos productos los comercializa en el mercado, en horario de 1:00 p.m. a 6:00 p.m., también vende café y chocolate. Esta actividad la aprendió de su mama quien le ha enseñado el proceso y la elaboración de estos productos. 

Compra la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos en el mercado central de la ciudad que se encuentra ubicado a medio kilómetro de donde ella reside los productos que compra son: repollos, maíz, yuca, guineo verde, aceite. Entre otros  más.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 6 repollos, un quintal de maíz, 6 canastos de yuca, 150 guineos verdes, 5 galones de aceite, entre otros más. También parte del financiamiento será invertido en seguir con la construcción de la vivienda.  Con la inversión, incrementaran las ventas y de esta manera obtendrá mayores ganancias y tendrá mas solvencia económica la costear los gastos de la casa y también podrá ayudar a sus nietas con el estudio. 

Los planes a futuro que tiene la señora es seguir con la construcción de la vivienda, ya que actualmente no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para terminar el proyectó de la construcción.
texts.en:
María, 34, is single and has two daughters.  She’s worked for more than ten years making enchiladas, fried bananas, fried manioc, nuégados [sweet made from flour, nuts and honey] and chilate [beverage made from roasted corn, chili and cocoa often flavored with anise, pepper, ginger and cinnamon].  She then sells these products in the market from 1pm until 6pm; she also sells coffee and chocolate.  She learned this activity from her mother who taught her how to process and make these products.

She buys the raw materials in her city’s central marked located about half a kilometer from where she lives.  The products she buys are cabbage, manioc, corn, green plantains and oil, among others.

The loan she’s requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy six cabbages, a quintal of corn, six baskets of manioc, 150 green plantains, 5 gallons of oil, among others.  Part of the loan will be used to continue building her house.  With this investment her sales will increase and she’ll earn higher profits thus having more economic solvency to cover household expenses and help with her granddaughters’ schooling costs.

Her plan for the future is to continue with the house construction because she currently does not have the resources needed to finish the construction project.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and part of it will be used to continue building her house.

loans.name: Guard Barranco Group

texts.es: Socias formado por tres microempresarias de éxitos una de ellas es Sandra quien vende ropa, y comenzó vendiendo cosméticos Avon desde hace 5 años, actualmente su esposo le ayuda a la comercialización de la ropa, este crédito lo quiere invertir en la compra de ropa nueva, Los otros miembro del grupo son Sonia destaza cerdos y la comercializa en las ventas y vende nacatamales en su casa es reconocida en la vecindad Claudia vende ropa usada, en la comunidad y en los mercados.
texts.en: This group is composed of three successful micro entrepreneurs. Sandra is one of them, and she sells clothes. 5 years ago she started selling Avon cosmetics, and now she and her husband sell clothes. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy new clothes. The other members of the group are Sonida, who sells cut-up pork, and she also sells nactamales (typical Nicaraguan dish) in her house and she in renown in her community; and Claudia, who sells used clothes in her neighborhood and in the markets.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Las Musas Group

texts.es: Socias formada por tres clientes emprendedoras una de ellas Dina Mayra tiene una pequeña librería anteriormente hace año y medio solo era venta de cuadernos, actualmente ofrece variedad de productos y de muy buena calidad y ofrece precios competitivos, su hijo mayor le ayuda en la atención en el negocio . El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de uniformes escolares como faldas, camisas, pantalones etc. Los otros miembros de grupo son Brenda vende ropa usada y hace 6 meses comenzó con la venta de cremas para el cuerpo, Carmen María vende nacatamales  y ropa nueva.
texts.en: This group is composed of three resourceful women. Dina Mayra is one of them and she runs a small bookshop. Up to one and a half years ago she sold only notebooks, but now she sells a variety of products of very good quality at competitive prices. Her eldest son helps her attending the shop. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of school uniform items such as skirts, shirts and trousers. The other members of the group are Brenda, who sells used clothes and who started selling body lotions 6 months ago; and Carmen María, who sells nactamales (typical Nicaraguan dish) and clothes.

loans.use: To buy school uniform items suche as skirts, trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Jesiel

texts.en:
Jesiel is from Poblacion, Bonifacio. She is 28 years old. Jesiel is married and has three children. To make a living, she plants and harvests coconuts for sale. She has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns PHP15,000 a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Jesiel joined GDMPC. Jesiel is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is from Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Jennifer is married and has one child. To make a living, she manages a fishing business, buying and selling fish and crabs. She has been in her business for 12 years and earns PHP 12,000 a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Jennifer joined GDMPC. Jennifer is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Dulcisima

texts.en:
Dulcisima is widowed with four children. Dulcisima is 87 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban.

Dulcisima is a farmer and grows coconuts  to earn a living. Dulcisima has been doing this for 15 years. Dulcisima has requested a loan to purchase additional coconut crops.

Dulcisima has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Dulcisima hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconut crops.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is from Migpange, Bonifacio. She is 32 years old. Gemma is married and has three children. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been engaged in her business for 8 years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, she joined GDMPC. 

Gemma is requesting a loan of 3,500 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en:
Benigna is 50 years of age and lives in Aquino, Tangub City. She is married with six adult children. She has worked in the fishing industry for almost one year. She earns 350 P per day to support their needs. 

Benigna has requested a loan for fishing materials. Benigna is a one-year member of PMPC. In the future, Benigna hopes that her living standard will improve.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel, 40 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Bonifacio with two children and is earning a living from his transport service business. It has been in existence for almost 11 years now and he earns 40,000 PHP a month. To improve business, he is borrowing the amount of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which he just joined recently, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Glory Jane

texts.en:
This is Glory Jane.  She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Glory Jane hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members each week to share stories of her work, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Los Rosales De Huascata Group

texts.es:
Saludos desde Peru! Maritza es la Presidenta del grupo Los Rosales de Huastaca, que está empezando su segundo ciclo con Edaprospo.

Maritza tiene una imprenta desde hace un año, donde hace libros para escuelas primarias y secundarias. Maritza es profesora, pero después de tener un accidente y tener que retirarse del magisterio, decidió aplicar su larga experiencia como docente en este negocio. Ella recibe los pedidos de los colegios y después escribe los libros, los imprime y los anilla.

Maritza ha solicitado el préstamo para comprar repuesto para máquinas de impresión, porque 2 de sus máquinas se malograron. Ella tiene muchas ganas de seguir implementando su negocio y su próxima prioridad es sacar todos los permisos necesarios.

Maritza tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Como profesora, su mayor preocupación es asegurar los estudios de sus hijos, y por eso desea aumentar sus ingresos.

Maritza es la señora que está a la izquierda de la primera fila, y que en el video presenta al grupo.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! Maritza is chair of the "Los Rosales de Huasteca" group, which is starting its second loan cycle with Edaprospo. 

Moritz has had a printing house for a year, where she makes books for primary and secondary schools. Moritz is a teacher, but after having an accident and having to retire from teaching, she decided to apply her long experience as a teacher to this business. She receives orders from schools, then writes the books, prints them, and ring-binds them. 

Maritza has applied for the loan in order to buy parts for printers, because two of her machines have broken down. She has a great desire to continue running her business, and her next priority is to take out all the necessary permits.

Maria is 37 years old. She is married and has three children. As a teacher, her greatest concern is ensuring that her children receive an education, and that is why she wishes to increase her income.

Maritza is the woman on the left in the first row, and is the one presenting the group in the video.

loans.use: To buy parts for printers, for her business making books for schools.

loans.name: Magin Isai

texts.es:
Magin, se dedica a la venta de ropa americana y usada, el vive junto a su familia con su esposa y un hijo quienes depende económicamente de el, el negocio tiene tres años de existir trabajando desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, lo aprendio a través de la iniciativa propia viéndose en la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingreso a su familia.

El manifiesta que necesita realizar la compra de más mercadería para aumentar el negocio y surtirlos las nuevas rentas, por eso está solicitando un préstamo que le ayude en la obtención de blusas, faldas, pantalones, aumentando el inventario y así podrá tener más opciones de venta a los clientes.

Su objetivo es en el futuro mejorar la calidad de vida, esperando que su negocio sea rentable a largo plazo y le ayude a realizarse.
texts.en:
Magin works in the sale of American and used clothing. He lives with his wife and only child, who depend financially on him. His business has existed for three years now and he works from eight in the morning to five in the afternoon. He started this business on his own, after noticing he needed to create a source of income for his family. 

He needs to buy more merchandise in order to expand his business and be able to supply for new sales. This is why he is requesting a loan to purchase blouses, skirts and trousers, increasing his inventory so that he can offer a wider variety of products to his clients.  

His objective to the future is to improve his quality of life through his business, by making sure it is profitable in the long term.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts and trousers.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene 7 hijos y vive en el municipio de Villanueva, Cortes. Ella lleva 8 años trabajando duro en su negocio con la venta de tortillas de maíz. Vende todo el día atendiendo bien a su clientela. Con este negocio ella apoya a sus hijos con el estudio y cubre otros gastos del hogar. Ella está solicitando ya un segundo préstamo a ODEF, el cual es por 7,000 Lempiras, con este préstamo se va abastecer de materia prima y va aumentar las ventas, va comprar harina de maíz para la elaboración de  tortillas y leña con la cual cocina dichas tortillas. Todo su esfuerzo es por lograr que su negocio crezca para ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien y se gradúen.
texts.en: Dominga, 36, is married and has seven children; she lives in the municipality of Villanueva, Cortes.  She’s been working hard for 8 years in her business selling corn tortillas.  She sells all day taking care of her customers well.  She supports her children’s schooling by means of this business and covers other household expenses.  She’s asking for her second ODEF loan for 7,000 Lempiras to stock up on raw materials to increase sales.  She is going to buy corn flour to make tortillas and firewood to cook them.  All her efforts are in order to succeed in making her business grow in order to help her children attend school and to graduate.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like corn flour and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Dúo San Juan Group

texts.es: Dúo San Juan: Doña Gloria Antonieta es originaria de San Juan Comalapa, tiene 5 hijos a su cargo ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano (fajas y güipiles) es una persona que lucha día a día para sacar adelante a su familia, por eso está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano, espera que kiva le pueda dar ese apoyo que ella necesita para salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
San Juan Duo.

Gloria Antonieta is from San Juan Comalapa.  She has five children in her care and she works manufacturing traditional textiles by hand (sheaths and skirts).  She’s a woman who strives daily to move her family forward which is why she’s requested this loan to buy raw materials to make hand woven traditional textiles.  She hopes Kiva will be able to give her this support she needs to continue moving forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed to hand weave traditional textiles.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
El señor Silverio es originario del estado de Veracruz, tiene ya mas de ocho años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. 
El señor Silverio cuenta con un negocio de venta de paletas de hielo, nieves, licuados y aguas frescas de sabores naturales, tiene  ya mas de cinco años dedicándose a la venta, estas solicitando el préstamo para invertir en mercancía para la temporada de invierno que es (venta de nachos preparados, elotes desgranados, chocolate caliente y tamales).pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio.
Con esta inversión a su negocio obtendrá más ganancias y podrá ayudar a su familia a salir a delante y también pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Silverio is originally from the state of Veracruz and he has been in Nuevo Laredo for more than eight years.

Silverio has a business selling ice pops, ice cream, shakes, and naturally flavored beverages. For more than five years he has made a living in sales. He is requesting a loan to invest in merchandise for the winter season such as prepared nachos sales, kernel corn, hot chocolate, and tamales. However, he does not have the necessary money for this investment and he does not want to pull the capital from his business.

With his investment in his business he will obtain more profits and be able to help his family to get ahead and also repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Magnolia Group

texts.es: Grupo Magnolia formado por cinco socias microempresarias emprendedoras las cuales todas tienen actividades como Samaria vende ropa nueva y ropa interior desde hace 3 años, tiempo de estar con la institución 4 años  el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva y ropa interior de mejor calidad, sus aspiraciones es llegar a tener su propio capital de trabajo, María Isabel su negocio es venta de fritanga, Concepción vende cosméticos de la  Avon, y zapatos, María Elena vende fritanga en los estadios ambulante, Mercedes tiene un puesto de verduras en su domicilio y una pulpería.
texts.en:
Grupo Magnolia is made up of five small business owning female entrepreneurs who all work in areas similar to Samaria, who has been selling new clothing and underwear for three years. She has been a group member for four years and she will invest this loan in buying new clothes and underwear of higher quality. Her hope is to manage to maintain her own working capital. 

Maria Isabel has a business selling fried snacks. Concepción sells Avon cosmetics and shoes. Maria Elena sells fried snacks at stadiums, and Mercedes has a fruit stand in her home and a corner store.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing and underwear of higher quality for sale.

loans.name: Norafil

texts.en:
This is Norafil, She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used buy more products such as meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and with their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Norafil dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work. She also hopes to have her own food stall some day.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories about her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 61 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban. Eliza is widowed with four children. 

To earn a living, Eliza has a small restaurant business selling foods in the community. Eliza earns about PHP 3500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients such as oil, iodized salt, sauce, etc.

Eliza has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Eliza would like to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as oil, iodized salt, sauce, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia, 53, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Jerry and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Delia operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers rugs, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Delia hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more raw materials like thread and cloth needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 65 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children. 

Rosita is engaged in a coconut buying and selling business and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in  purchasing coconuts for her coconut buying business.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing coconuts for her coconut buying business

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 37 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school.

Jenalyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenalyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed & vitamins for her pigs.

Jenalyn has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dúo De Sumpango Group

texts.es: Dúo de Sumpango: este Dúo está conformado por la señora Norma originaria de Sumpango, es soltera y una persona muy trabajadora y responsables todos los día se levantan muy temprano para poder realizar sus actividades, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de mas mercadería en productos comestibles ya que necesita tener más mercadería para satisfacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
One member of the group Dúo de Sumpango is Norma, originally from Sumpango, who is single and a very hard-working and responsible person. Every day they wake up early to be able to get their activities done. She makes a living selling edible products in a convenience store. 

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more grocery product merchandise, since she needs to have more merchandise to satisfy her needs.

loans.use: to buy more grocery product merchandise

loans.name: Cesar Joaquin

texts.es:
Don Cesar, de 56 años de edad de oficio comerciante, tiene una pulpería y venta de comidas. Este negocio es familiar el atiende la pulpería y su esposa vende comida. Tienen dos hijos mayores de edad.  La ayuda atravez de los financiamiento ha resultado un cambio positivo para su negocio ya que le permite invertir en  mercadería para su negocio y mejorar las ventas se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado y que recibe en el momento más oportuno. 
Él está necesitando el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, carne y pollo. Tanto para surtir su pulpería como para hacer comida para vender.
texts.en:
Cesar is 56 years old and a merchant by trade. He has a small general store and sells food. This is a family business. He runs the general store and his wife sells food. 

They have two adult children. The help through the loan has resulted in a positive change for his business, as it allows him to invest in merchandise and improve sales. 

He feels very grateful for the support provided, which he is receiving at the most opportune time. He needs the loan in order to buy rice, cooking oil, meat and chicken; both for stocking his grocery store and for making food to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, meat and chicken.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Sra.  Teresa tiene 44 años tiene cuatro hijos que son de las edades de 5, 7, 11 y 17 años, que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas  y refrescos, actividad que realiza todos los días en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio de la zona jardín del Sur, ofreciendo a su clientela variedad de refrescos como jugos La mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia la misma que  desarrolla algunas veces con la ayuda de sus hijos quien  le ayudan a preparar y atender a sus clientes, el destino del crédito es para la compra por mayor de refrescos por mayor para lograr tener una despensa llena,  la Sra. Teresa es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad y está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Teresa, 44, has four children whose ages are 5, 7, 11 and 17; they are all school age.  She sells soft-drinks and turnovers, an activity she carries out daily in her food stand located at home in the Jardín del Sur zone.  She sells a variety of beverages like juices.  Said activity is her main source of income for her and her family.  Sometimes her children help her with the work in both the preparation and with customer service.  The loan will be used to buy soft-drinks at wholesale in order to have a full stock.  Teresa is a very hardworking woman who has been in this activity for years.  She’s very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Las Posesionarias Group

texts.es: Las posesionarias nos un grupo solidario conformado por 6 mujeres trabajadoras, nombrado así por su primer asesora, tiene 6 ciclos con el crédito y todas habitan en el municipio regiomontano. Myriam es la líder del grupo, una mujer de 30 años, casada y con 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad (ambos son estudiantes). Su esposo se dedica a impermeabilizar casas y Myriam lo quiso ayudar con los gastos familiares. Primero la invitaron a vender joyería y como a ella le gustan las ventas acepto, después comenzó a vender colchas y otros artículos y también puso un snak fuera de su casa. El crédito lo utilizara para resurtir el snak y comprar artículos para bebe como: carriolas, porta bebes, y demás. Myriam desea conseguir un local para vender su mercancía de manera mas cómoda tanto para ella como para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Las posesionarias is a solidary group composed of 6 working women, which was named by its first advisor. It has six loans and all of them live in the Regiomontano municipality. 

Myriam is the group's leader. She is a 30-year-old woman, who is married with two children that are 10 and 8 years old (both students). Her husband waterproofs houses and Myriam wanted to help him with the family expenses. She was first invited to sell jewelry, and because she likes sales, she accepted. Then, she started to sell quilts and other items, and started a snack kiosk outside her house. 

She will use the loan to resupply the snack kiosk and to buy baby items, such as strollers, carriers and more. Myriam would like to acquire an establishment so she can sell her merchandise more comfortably, both for her and for her customers.

loans.use: to resupply the snack kiosk and buy baby items.

loans.name: Thuc

texts.en:
Thuc was born in 1980. She has two children, who are studying at primary school. Her husband is a farmer. His income is about 2,500,000 VND per month. Thuc raises ducks to earn a living. She earns 2,500,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are thus about 5,000,000 VND per month. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy more duck to breed, raise and sell. She wants her children to go to school till university.

loans.use: to buy more ducks to breed, raise and sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is from Bagumbang, Bonifacio. She is 39 years old. Cheryl is married and has 3 children. To make a living, she manages a fishpond, where she raises fish, crabs and shrimp for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 13 years and earns 12,000 PHP a month from these activities. This year, Cheryl joined GDMPC. Cheryl is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to buy twine and young fish to raise, in order to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy twine and young fish to raise, in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is a married woman with one child. Cheryl is 33 years old and resides at Pangabuan, Tangub City. She owns and operates a general store, where she sells a variety of products to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. She earns 10,000 PHP a month from this business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Cheryl been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Cheryl wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand the product offerings in her general store.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is a 39 year old, hard working woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, three sons and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver, and all of her children are studying in private school. For two years, she herself has been running a vegetable shop in the market to offer more variety to clients. 

As a member of an eight person lending group, Perveen has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of vegetables and fruits for her shop. With the profit amount, she is interested in opening a new shop near her house, as the current shop is too far from her residence. 

Perveen hopes for a bright future for her children. Many thanks from her to all staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: In the picture, Perveen is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables and fruits for her shop.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and married with five children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like canned food, toiletries, and drinks to sell in her general store.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Josephine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 39 years old, married to Susan and blessed with three children, ages 9, 7 and 5 years old, respectively. He sells shoes and clothes, a business he started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000.

He has requested his second loan of KES 20,000 to purchase shoes and clothes to sell. The profit made will help him repay his loan.

He dreams of owning a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: la Sra.
