Khadijah is a 23-year-old single female from Al Hashmi in Jordan. She requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for cosmetics and perfumes for nearby customers. Khadijah is looking forward to improving the financial and social conditions of her family.

Since Khadijah is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics and perfumes to re-sell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 48 years old. A business lady, she is a single mother of three children. She has been running an eatery for the past six years with the monthly income of KES 10,500 which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her fourth loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. 


Pauline will use the loan to purchase more stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 


Her hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita's main source of income comes from her gardening business. She is 35 years old, married and has two children. She is from Bayabas, Aurora and been two years in gardening, earning an amount of 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Charlita joined GDMPC. Charlita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten sacks of barnyard fowl guano.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Loida

texts.es:
Loida tiene 32 años, está casada con Pedro, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 12, 9, 7 y 4 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Loida es una mujer responsable. Se dedica a la agricultura en sus propios terrenos. 
Al lado de su esposo Pedro trabaja todos los días, porque sabe que si trabaja con mayor constancia, sus productos tendrán mayor apariencia y serán negociados con facilidad. “en esta comunidad los granos de café son más saludables porque los abonos que les echamos son naturales”, comenta orgullosa.
Sus principales cultivos constan de café y plátanos, pero hay temporadas cuando también produce maíz y yucas, pero no es frecuente.
Le va muy bien en sus negocios.
Pero el proceso no es sencillo, el trabajo requiere tiempo y dedicación.
Tiene muchos planes para el futuro, el más cercano es comprarse es continuar con sus cultivos. Este mes empezará a limpiar y abonar las tierras, para ello requiere de su apoyo. Éste es el préstamo número 2 con MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Le agrada trabajar con sus socios, porque en el primer ciclo obtuvieron buenos ahorros.  
Con los 1500 soles, Loida podrá comprar 10 bolsas de fertilizantes, para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café y plátanos.
texts.en:
Loida, 32, is married to Pedro and they have four children who are 12, 9, 7 and 4 years old.  They all live in their own house located in a native community in the central jungle.  Loida is a responsible woman.  She works in agriculture on her own land.

She works every day alongside her husband, Pedro, because she knows that if she works with more constancy, her product will look better and be sold easily.  “Coffee beans in this community are healthier because the manure we use is natural,” she comments proudly.

Her main crops are coffee and bananas but sometimes there are seasons when she also grows corn and manioc but this isn’t too frequently.  She does well in her businesses but the process isn’t simple, it requires time and dedication.

She has many plans for the future.  The most immediate one is to continue with her crops.  This month she will start to weed and fertilize the soil and needs your help to do so.  

This is MFP loan #2 so she assumes the responsibility of being punctual with her monthly installment payments.  She enjoys working with her fellow members because they attained good savings during the first cycle.  Loida will be able to buy ten sacks of fertilizer to spread among her coffee and banana plants with the 1,500 soles.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 54 años y es viudo. Vive con su hija y su nieta en una casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Desde niño aprendió estas labores ayudando a sus padres en el campo, por eso se desempeña como agricultor.  Su experiencia se ve reflejada en la producción y ganancias que su actividad le genera. En sus 3 cuadras de terrenos cultiva café, plátanos y yucas.
“Lo más difícil es llevar toda la cosecha hasta los mercados, porque la comunidad se ubica a 3 horas de viaje en camiones o autos”, menciona.
Rolando ya es un hombre mayor pero no se queja de su trabajo, para avanzar y evitarse fatigas contrata personal. Así limpia y cosecha el café y no descuida sus ventas.
Estos días son importantes para abonar sus tierras, por eso solicita de su apoyo para adquirir fertilizantes. Éste es su segundo crédito con MFP. Por eso muestra firmeza al mencionar que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los Productores Yaneshas”. Menciona que le agrada trabajar en equipo por los ahorros y apoyo solidario.
Destinará los 2000 soles en la compra de bolsas de fertilizantes orgánicos para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Rolando is 54 years old and a widower. He lives with his daughter and his granddaughter in their own house located in an indigenous community in the central tropical forest region. 

He learned this work from a young age by helping his parents in the fields. This is why he works as a farmer. His experience is reflected in the output and earnings that his work generates. 

On his 4.5 acres of land he grows coffee, plantains and yuca. The most difficult part is taking the entire harvest to market, because the community is located a three-hour trip away by truck or car, he says. 

Rolando is already an older man, but he doesn't complain about his work. In order to make progress and make the work easier, he hires workers. This way he does clearing, harvests the coffee, and doesn't neglect his sales.

These days are important for fertilizing his land, and that is why he is requesting your help in order to buy fertilizer. 

This is his second loan with MFP, and that is why he states firmly that he will make his installment payments on time. He says that he enjoys working as a team, because of the savings plan and the mutual support. He will earmark 2000 soles to buy bags of organic fertilizer for his coffee plantings.

loans.use: To buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Floro

texts.en: Floro is 37 years old and has a business selling fish. This business has been running for almost one year. Floro has three children; the oldest is ten years old. He works hard to support his family. Floro has requested this loan to purchase more fish. In the future, he hopes to expand his fish-selling business to support his family and to send his children to school for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo de 27 años, convive con Mari, la madre de sus 2 hijos: Gaby de 7 años y Michez de 3. Esta familia vive en una casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.

Arturo es un joven de carácter entusiasta. Se dedica a la agricultura. Gracias a sus padres y a la comunidad, cuenta con 3 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos donde produce café, plátanos y maíz.
“Estos 3 productos son rentables, depende como los negocie y trabaje, pero me esmero más en el cultivo de café”, dice. Arturo lleva como 9 años en esta actividad, y menciona que lo más difícil de su trabajo es trasladar sus cosechas hasta la ciudad.
 Invierte mucho dinero en el flete, fertilizantes orgánicos, pago de jornaleros y otros, si embargo sus resultados en las cosechas son satisfactorios.
Tiene que abonar sus plantas cada 6 meses, para asegurar su crecimiento y formación de los granos, por eso esta vez solicita de su apoyo para adquirir abonos orgánicos.
Le gusta su trabajo y en sus planes futuros está ampliar sus sembríos. Es la segunda vez que Arturo recibe un préstamo de MFP, por eso muestra firmeza al mencionar que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los productores Yaneshas”, es su banco comunal y se siente contenta de tener socios responsables. Le agrada la idea de los ahorros y el crecimiento de los socios en equipo.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de 15 bolsas de abonos orgánicos para fertilizar las tierras del café. Así asegurará una buena cosecha para el próximo año.
texts.en:
Arturo, 27, lives with Mari, the mother of his two children: Gaby, age 7, and Michez, age 3. The family lives in their own home, located in a native community in the central forest.

Arturo is a very enthusiastic young man. He works in agriculture. Thanks to his parents and the community, he has three parcels of farm land where he grows coffee, bananas, and corn. "These three products are profitable. It depends on how I negotiated and worked, but I work harder growing coffee," he says. Arturo has been doing this for about nine years, and he says that the most difficult part of his job is getting his crops to the city.

He invests a lot of money in freight, organic fertilizer, paying workers and others. However, his results from the harvests are satisfactory. He has to fertilize his crops every six months, to ensure their growth and the formation of the grains. This is why this time he is looking for support to get organic fertilizer. He likes his work and his plan for the future to increase his planted fields. This is the second time Arturo has received a loan from MFP, and he is firmly committed to making his payments on time.

 "Los productores Yaneshas" is his communal bank and he is glad to have responsible co-members. He likes the idea of saving and the growth of the members as a team. He will invest the money in 15 bags of organic fertilizer to fertilize the land where he grows coffee. That way he is sure to have a good harvest next year.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire field hands.

loans.name: Maria Deysi

texts.es: María Deysi de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive junto hijo y su nuera en casa alquilada, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en el lugar de su residencia, tiene varios años de trabajar con el pequeño negocio y ha adquirido experiencia valiosa que le permite agilizar la producción de tortillas, gracias al buen manejo de la venta siempre obtiene las mejores ganancias, la comunidad donde vive es muy transitada y ya tiene mucha clientela, aunque sus mejores clientes son los vecinos, todos la prefieren porque su producto es de calidad, a un precio accesible y sobre todo con el servicio mas rápido del lugar; María es una mujer activa, decidida y muy dedicada a su labor, desea salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños por eso todos los días se esfuerza al máximo en el trabajo pues sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito que tanto espera, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, leña, etc. María Deysi tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Maria Deysi is 48 years old, and lives with her son and daughter-in-law in a rented house. 

She sells tortillas from her home and has been working in her small business for several years. She has acquired valuable experience that allows her to speed up the production of tortillas. Thanks to the good management of her sales, she always obtains the best earnings. 

The community where she lives is very busy and she already has a lot of customers, although her best clients are the neighbors. Everyone prefers her because her product is good quality, affordable and especially because the service is the fastest in the neighborhood.

Maria is an energetic woman: determined, and very devoted to her work. She wishes to succeed and fulfill her dreams. That is why every day she does her very best in her work, as she knows that only in this way will she achieve the success she so much hopes for. 

Maria Deysi has good payment references and is very responsible. She states that she will be able to pay off the debt, and at the same time has faith that she will bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: To buy corn at wholesale, and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 20 bags of poultry manure.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara de cuarenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su hija Mónica y sus padres en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, naranjas, fresas, plátanos, tomates, cebollas, papas, chiles, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias,  comercia de forma ambulante en diferentes zonas de la comunidad donde reside, ya tiene mucha clientela fija que la prefiere por la calidad del producto, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el servicio inigualable; Clara es una mujer humilde, activa y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran camino a un futuro prospero, su mas grande secreto en esta lucha por alcanzar el éxito es la constancia y el amor que todos los días le pone al trabajo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión y no decepcionar a los clientes por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar fruta y verdura por mayor. Clara tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza de darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Clara, 41, lives in her own house with her daughter Monica and her parents. She sells fruits and vegetables, like oranges, strawberries, bananas, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, chilies, among others. She’s had this business for many years and has gained a lot of experience in sales, which has allowed her to make more financial gains. Her business is mobile and she sells in different areas of the community where she lives; she has secured a clientele who prefer her products for their quality, good prices and mostly for her unequaled service. Clara is a humble and active woman, very dedicated to her work. She’s always alert to new opportunities that can lead the way to a prosperous future. Her biggest secret in the fight to succeed is perseverance and love, which she puts into her work every day. In the last weeks, demand for her products has increased and she’d like to take advantage of this by making a new investment in her business to please her clients. That’s why she’s requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables. Clara has good payment references and is very responsible. She is certain that she can pay back the loan, and hopes to do so, while giving her family a full life.

loans.use: buy wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en:
Somaly is 29 years old. She lives with her family in a rural village located in the Kror Kor district of the Pursat province. She is married with two dependent children; one is still in school while the remaining one helps with the family’s business. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for two years. Beside this, she also sells grocery items to earn additional income for the family. The current business earns her about 16,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 7,000 KHR each day for their future needs. Having insufficient working capital is the main challenge.

Somaly’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. She successfully paid back the loan, which has improved her rice-paddy business. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying more grocery items. She hopes to grow her rice well so as to sell it for a good price to improve her family’s life style.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Griselda Isabel

texts.es: Griselda Isabel de veinticinco años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia; ella posee un chalet donde vende alimentos y golosinas en una escuela de la localidad donde reside, tiene tres años con este negocio y ha adquirido muy buena experiencia que le permite obtener siempre excelentes ganancias, los estudiantes son sus mejores clientes y la prefieren porque todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y sobre todo con un servicio inigualable; Griselda es una mujer humilde, decidida, dedicada a su labor y entregada a sus sueños, dia a dia se esfuerza por lograr un futuro prospero, su mas grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito que tanto desea es la constancia y el amor a su trabajo, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión, pero para ello necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pan, embutidos, fruta, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Griselda tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Griselda Isabel, 25, lives with her family in her own house. She has a kiosk where she sells food and candy in a school in the area where she lives. She’s had this business for 3 years and has acquired some very good experience, which has allowed her to make excellent financial gains. The students are her best customers and they prefer her because everything she sells is of the finest quality at good prices and come with unequaled customer service. Griselda is a very humble, decided woman, dedicated to her work and ready to make her dreams come true. She works day to day to attain a prosperous future. Her biggest secret to attain the success she wants is perseverance and love of her work. Like all good business owners, she wants to grow her business and make a new investment; but to do this, she needs capital. That’s why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy bread, sausages, fruit, candy, drinks, etc. Griselda has good payment references and is very responsible. She is certain she can pay back the loan, and at the same time, she confides that she can take home some financial security.

loans.use: buy bread, sausages, fruit, candy, drinks.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима очень трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 28  лет, она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Более 2 года она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, пшеницу, морковь и т.п. Полученный доход она продает на рынке. Ее муж помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами она хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого она должна получить больше урожая. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и семена. Доход, который она будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для образования своих детей и улучшения условия жизни. Она нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Fotima is a very hardworking woman.  She is 28 years old, married and raising three children.  She has been involved in growing agricultural crops, such as potatoes, wheat, carrots and the like, for over two years.  She sells her products at a market.  Her husband helps her to run the business.  Fotima wants to develop her business in order to provide the family with all of the necessities and needs to get a bigger harvest to do this.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of $3000 to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds.  The income received from the business will be used to educate her children and improve the quality of life.  She needs and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 30-year-old married man who has 2 family members. He lives in Baqa'a Amman, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to pay for his home improvements. He would like to buy some new furniture and new electronics. In the future, he hopes to buy a new home to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for his home improvements

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is applying for her second loan with KADET, LTD. after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase her income and improve the living standard for her family.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Aged 45 years, Mom lives in a rural village located in the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Cambodia. She is a married mother of seven children, five of whom are dependent on her. For the last twelve years, Mom has been farming rice on one-hectare of farmland to make a living while her husband catches fish in the local area to earn additional income. Together, they can earn about KHR 7,000 per day from their current businesses and can save about KHR 4,000 each day for their future needs. Having insufficient working capital and water are the main challenges.

This is the third loan for Mom’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loans, which she fully repaid, have helped her family in getting a sufficient amount of food. She is leading her group to ask for a loan with VisionFund in the amount of 250,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fishing supplies such as cast nets, fishing pliers, etc. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income so as to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire day labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal FUENTE DE VIDA,el banco se encuentra situado en el distrito de Cusco,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia tiene 63 años de edad,03 hijos y es viuda,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cafeteria,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia vende cafes,hamburguesas,jugos entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solicitan,su negocio se encuentra ubicado por el centro de la ciudad,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de una vitrina nueva para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito ortorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank “Fuente de Vida” (Fountain of Life) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.  She is 63 years old, widowed, and has three children.  The member divides her time between her daily activities and managing her cafeteria business.  She has been in business for years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day.  She sells coffee, hamburgers, juices, and other items that all of her customers request.  Her business is located in the central part of the city.  She is a responsible and industrious person who works in order to help her family get ahead.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a new display case for her business. The member is grateful for the loan that has been granted and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy a new display case for her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de bebidas como cervezas y gaseosas,ella vende al por mayor desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de cervezas y gaseosas.La socia solicita el credito apra comprar gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to dedicate herself to her beverage sales business, such as beer and soda. She sells them wholesale from 8am until 10pm. She has been doing this for several years and it's going very well. Her dream is to grow her beverage selling business. She is asking for the credit to purchase beer and soda at wholesale.

She is happy with the loan and is dedicated to paying according to her payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale beer and sodas

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine, 31, is married, has three children and lives in the Philippines. Geraldine operates a coconut production farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years and every month she earns 15,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Geraldine been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Geraldine hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Emperatriz María

texts.es: Emperatriz, que trabaja vendiendo mercancías variadas y también tiene una escuela pre-escolar en su casa,  ha aplicado su previo crédito de Kiva para comprar ropa, zapatos y juguetes y  todo esto lo vendió a su clientela y la impactó positivamente. Fue muy útil para ella, tener productos en suministro, para vender    durante el fin de año, porque la demanda fue muy alta y ganó dinero. Ahora, Emperatriz está aplicando a  un nuevo préstamo en Kiva para comprar elementos educativos, electrodomésticos, ropa, calzado, y más juguetes. Sus clientes ya tienen encargados estos productos. Emperatriz le gustaría decir a sus fondeadores lo siguiente: “Con su apoyo he salido adelante en mi negocio, gracias. Espero que me sigan apoyando para poder cumplirle a mis clientes con los pedidos.”
texts.en: On top of being engaged in selling various products, Emperatriz also runs a kindergarten in her house. She has used her previous Kiva loan to buy clothes, shoes and toys, all items that she has sold to her customers with a positive outcome. It has been greatly useful for her to have a supply of products to sells during the end-of-the-year season, as she has received many requests and she has earned good money. Emperatriz is now requesting a new loan to Kiva to buy educational items, electrical household appliances, clothes, shoes and more toys, as her customers have already placed orders with her for these products. This is what Emperatriz would like to say to her founders: “Thank you, because I have been able to make my activity progress thanks to your support. I hope that you will keep on supporting me in order to satisfy my customers’ requests.”

loans.use: To buy educational items, electrical household appliances, clothes, shoes and toys.

loans.name: Diego Antonio

texts.es: Diego Antonio de veintiséis años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos en casa propia; él se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, piñas, sandias, naranja, tomates, cebollas, chiles, entre otros, tiene varios años con el pequeño negocio y se ha hecho de experiencia en las ventas que le permiten obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia de forma ambulante con su vehiculo en diferentes lugares de la comunidad donde vive y ya tiene mucha clientela fija que lo prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan, con producto de calidad, buenos precios y sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Diego es un hombre enérgico, dedicado a su labor y con muchas metas que desea alcanzar, todos los días busca alternativas que le muestren el camino a un futuro mas prospero y se esfuerza con amor y constancia al trabajo pues sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito que tanto desea, como todo buen comerciante ahora que aumentaron las ventas quiere realizar una nueva inversión para no decepcionar a los clientes, pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. Diego Antonio tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diego Antonio, 26, lives with his 2 children in his own home. He sells fruit and vegetables for a living: pineapples, watermelons, oranges, tomatoes, onions, chillies and other things.

He has had his own small business for several years, and his experience in sales has helped him to achieve a greater income. He works as a travelling salesman from his truck in various locations around his community and has a large fixed customer base, who choose him because he always has what they need - and guarantees high quality products, good prices and, above all, excellent service.

Diego is an energetic man, dedicated to his work and with many goals that he hopes to achieve. Everyday he seeks out new options to find the way to a more prosperous future. He works hard with love and consistency in his work as he knows that this is how he will achieve his dreams. 

Like any good salesman, now that he has improved his sales, he wants to invest further so as not to disappoint his customers, but he needs capital to do so. This is why he has requested a loan from INTEGRAL so he can buy wholesale fruits and vegetables.

Diego Antonio has good payment references and a good moral character, he is certain that he will be able to pay off the debt and, at the same time, provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land where she will build her home and business.

loans.name: Carmen Elisa

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 41 años, se describe como una persona emprendedora, felíz y le gusta aprender de todo para poder cumplir sus objetivos. Carmen vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en Ibarra.

Carmen tiene un puesto en el mercado donde se dedica a arreglar calzado de cuero, carteras de cuero, chompas de cuero y mochilas, este negocio le ayuda a Carmen a sustentar los gastos de su hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, para obtener mejores ingresos y mayor clientela Carmen realiza un crédito con el cual va a invertir en la compra de de cierres, fibras de cuero, tapas para zapatos, pintura, planchas de cuero e hilo para calzado.

Carmen sueña en tener un taller más grande, con máquinas industriales que le ayudarán a optimizar tiempo y mejoraran la calidad del cocido de los calzados.
texts.en:
Carmen is 41 years old.  She describes herself as an enterprising and happy person.  She likes to learn everything she needs to, to meet her goals.  Carmen lives with her husband and their three children in Ibarra.

Carmen has a stall in the market where she repairs leather shoes, billfolds, jackets and backpacks.  The business helps Carmen to support her family and meet her children's educational expenses.  In order to earn a better income and tend to more customers, Carmen is taking out a loan. She will invest the loan in the purchase of fasteners, synthetic leather, heel-pieces, dyes, leather irons and shoelaces. 

Carmen dreams of having a bigger workshop with industrial machines, which would help her to optimize her time and improve the quality of her footwear stitching.

loans.use: to purchase fasteners, synthetic leather, heel-pieces, dyes, leather irons and shoe laces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for retailing in cosmetics, perfumes, accessories and clothes from Aqaba, Jordan.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 36-year-old married woman who has three family members and is from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture and do maintenance on the home. In the future, she wants to expand her home to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan, 39, is a married mother of three who lives in a rural village of the Srey Snom District of Siem Reap Province. All of her children are dependent on her and still in school. For the last five years, Phan has been working as a rice farmer to support her family. She can earn about 5,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 2,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Phan has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles and she has completely paid back the loans. She has used the loans from VisionFund to better support her business and family’s living condition. Now, she is leading her group to request another loan of 300,000 KHR each. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to pay for labor fees transplanting rice seedlings. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice with healthful and fruitful yields so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay labor fees to transplant rice seedlings.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Kuña Aty 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Aty 3 de Mayo  fue formado en el barrio 3  de Mayo de la ciudad de Caaguazú, son 15 mujeres humildes y trabajadoras que buscan un mejor porvenir para ellas y sus familias.
Bernardina es una de ellas, es una persona con gran entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante, se dedica a la venta de leche, y cuenta que este es su principal trabajo y el que la ayuda a mantener a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar leche en cantidad, y así poder seguir dando un buen producto a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Aty 3 de Mayo" communal bank was established in the 3 de Mayo neighborhood in the city of Caaguazú. They are 15 humble and hard-working women who seek a better future for themselves and their families. 

Bernardina is one of them. She is a person with great enthusiasm and desire to succeed. She sells milk, and says that this is her main livelihood; one that helps her to support her family.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy milk in quantity. This will enable her to continue providing a good product to her customers.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Caritas Felices Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú, Este es el grupo “Caritas Felices” el cual está conformado por 07 personas responsables y trabajadoras que tienen como único propósito mejorar cada día. Este es el caso de  Yolinda  una mujer emprendedora que con los deseos de apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar decide emprender su propio negocio. Su actividad principal es la venta de prendas de vestir para niños y adultos,  la cual realiza a pedidos. Como actividad secundaría vende productos de belleza. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo ha mejorado su vivienda. El dinero que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de prendas de vestir como polos, pantalones y casacas; ya que tiene pedidos por entregar. Posteriormente piensa acondicionar una bodega en su vivienda, la cual le permitirá estar cerca de sus hijos.  Yolinda agradece el crédito recibido y se compromete a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa-Prosperidad. Yolinda es la segunda del lado derecho viste polo rojo y pantalón plomo lleva una gorra blanca.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru.  This is Yolinda, a member of the Caritas Felices group, which is made up of seven responsible and hardworking people whose only goal is to improve every day.

This Yolinda's situation.  She's an enterprising woman who, wanting to support her partner with the household expenses, decided to start her own business.  Currently she makes a living selling clothing for children and adults, which she does on order.  As a secondary job she sells beauty products.  With the fruit of her effort she has improved her home.

She'll use the money she requested to buy clothing such as polo shirts, pants, and jackets because she has orders to fill.

Later she plans to set up a store in her home, which will allow her to be close to her children.  Yolinda is grateful for the loan she received and promises to continue working well with the Prosperidad program.

Yolinda is the second from the right, wearing a red polo shirt, gray pants, and a white cap.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and daughter. 

Since 2004, her husband has had been running a fish shop in the main market as the only source of income for their family. He is a very hard working and honest person and he is capable of generating more income.

Kalsoom, a member of a six-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner Brac Pakistan to support the growth of her husband's fish shop. He hopes to increase his monthly income and save funds for the future of their only daughter. As the Muslim religious holiday, Eid-ul-Azah, is near,  she wants to purchase new clothes for her family as well from the profit generated.

Kalsoom dreams for her daughter's bright future and prays for husband's good health. Many thanks and best wishes for Kiva from her.
Note: in the picture Kalsoom holding a pass book in hand.

loans.use: to support the growth of her husband's fish shop.

loans.name: El Banquito Del Ahorro Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Esther es uno de los miembros del grupo El Banquito Del Ahorro

La Sra. Esther es separada vive con sus 03 hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Ella es presidenta del grupo y este es su segundo ciclo juntos. Esther tiene un restaurante de comidas, aprendió el oficio por sus padres quienes tenían un restaurante cuando ella era muy jovencita, fue allí donde aprendió todo sobre el negocio, hace 38 años inaguro su propio restaurante y es donde trabaja actualmente, la ubicación de su negocio es buena porque existen muchas fabricas por el lugar y son los trabajadores quienes acuden diariamente a consumir los alimentos que ella prepara. Su préstamo será de mucha utilidad para ella porque quiere empezar otro negocio de comidas rápidas y necesita ambientar otro espacio en su casa, con su préstamo podrá comprar algunas mesas y sillas que le hacen falta. En el futuro le gustaría que su restaurante se convierta en uno de los mejores, una de sus hijas estudia gastronomía y desea que ella continúe con sus sueños.
La Sra. Esther esta agradecida a todos los inversionistas por apoyarla en su negocio, en la fotografía ella viste casaca negra, es la tercera de la derecha.
En la foto adjunta al lado derecho se encuentra la Sra. Carmen Rosa.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the group El Banquito Del Ahorro. Esther is separated and lives with her three children who are now adults. She is the president of the group and this is her second cycle together. Esther has a restaurant; she learned the job from her parents who had a restaurant when she was very young. It was there where she learned everything about the business. She inaugurated her own restaurant 38 years ago, where she currently works. The location of her business is good because there are a lot of factories around the place and the workers come daily to eat the food she prepares. 

Her loan will be very useful for her because she wants to start another fast food business and needs to adapt another space in her house. With the loan she will buy some tables and chairs that are needed. In the future, she would like her restaurant to become one of the best. One of her daughters is studying gastronomy and she wants her to continue with her dreams. Esther is grateful to all the investors for supporting her in the business. In the picture she wears a black jacket, she is the third on the right. 

The small photo on the right is of Sra. Carmen Rosa.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: La Sra. Ana es socia del grupo  “Virgen de Guadalupe” conformado por  10 personas  unidas  y  responsables. En esta oportunidad conocerán algo más sobre Ana, ella es casada con 06 hijos, 03 de ellos aun son apoyados por Ana.  Ana comenzó vendiendo prendas de vestir,  poco a poco  pudo incrementar sus clientes, es así como decide emprender otro negocio donde mejoraría sus ingreso. Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de quesos. Se siente feliz por lo que ha conseguido, ya que gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo a podido mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su vivienda y así poner una boutique. Solicitó el crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, pues la demanda ha aumentado y necesita comprar más quesos. Ana agradece el crédito brindado. Ana está ubicada en la parte posterior es la tercera del lado izquierdo  viste polo morado y chaleco plomo.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” group which has ten, united and responsible members.  On this occasion, you will learn more about Ana.  

She’s married and has six children; she’s still supporting three of them.   Ana started out selling clothes and gradually acquired a clientele and this is how she decided to start another business to improve her income.  She’s currently a cheese merchant.  

She feels happy about what she’s accomplished because thanks to her effort and work she’s been able to improve her family’s quality of life.  Her greatest wish is to finish building her house and open a boutique.  

She requested the loan to continue investing in her business.  Ana is in the rear, third from the left, wearing a purple shirt and gray vest.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Amanecer De Huayhuasi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANECER DE HUAYHUASI”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Leonora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de guantes y gorros, tienda de barrio, elaboración de invitaciones, producción de papa, mecánico, producción de tejidos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Leonora es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que participa Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta y producción de arte gráfica; cuenta que esta técnica la aprendió en un instituto y posteriormente emprendió su propia tienda.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de la Ciudad de La paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en las ferias comunales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse económicamente.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro y los ahorros.
texts.en:
“Amanecer de Huayhuasi” (Huayhuasi’s Dawn) is a Communal Bank that will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Community Center. It is composed of ten members, guided by a directive board presided over by Leonora. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different activities such as producing gloves and hats, running a neighborhood store, making invitation cards, growing potatoes, mechanics and weaving fabrics.

Leonora is one of the micro entrepreneurs forming this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. Leonora says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for one year, and that she has been invited to enter by one of the promoters of this institution who came to visit her at her house. She currently engages in producing and selling graphic arts. She says she has learned the technique in an institution and then she has decided to start her own activity.

The loan she in now requesting will be used to increase her working capital (she will buy canvases) in the town of La Paz. She will then sell her products to the fairs of her community. This type of activity helps her earning an income to economically provide for herself.

When asked about what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the insurance and the savings.

loans.use: To buy canvas.

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona,  trabajan con la fundación desde el año 2010,  se encuentran  en el 7º ciclo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Silvia, ella tiene una despensa en su casa, y cuenta que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y con su negocio ayuda a su familia a salir adelante.
Cuenta la Sra. Silvia  que solicita el crédito compra de comestibles para volver a surtir su despensa, ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a esta oportunidad que recibe puede mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encarnacion.  They got together after learning about the Fundacion through some promotions in their neighborhood.  They have been working with the Fundacion since 2010, and are now in their 7th loan cycle.

One of the members of this group is Silvia, who has a store in her house.  She says that with a lot of sacrifice and effort she is getting ahead, and with her business she is helping to provide for her family.

Silvia states that she is requesting a loan to buy foodstuffs to stock up her store.  She is very grateful, because thanks to this opportunity that she is receiving, she will be able to increase her income and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy food products for her store

loans.name: Harrison Nguri

texts.en:
Harrison has operated his bakery shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years and the business has improved greatly. He has a good credit history with KADET LTD. 

Harrison has applied for his sixth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy baking flour and other cooking ingredients for his bakery.

In the future, Harrison hopes to grow his bakery shop and be a leading baker in the area.

loans.use: to buy baking flour and other cooking ingredients for his bakery.

loans.name: Sarou's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Siem Reap province in Srey Snom district, Sarou is 29 years old and married with two dependent children, all of whom are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice as her primary business for several years. The current business earns her approximately 10,000 KHR per day and she is able to save about 5,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Sarou’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. She is in her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland as well as to pay for labor fees for plowing the field. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell them for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is from Waterfall, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 52 years old and is married with one child. Marcelina earns a living raising crops, planting and harvesting corn for sale. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Marcelina joined GDMPC. Marcelina is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara used her previous loan to buy a dairy cow which has made her business greatly improve since the milk production increased.

She has requested a second loan of 40,000 KES to purchase animal feeds for her cows. The anticipated profit will aid her in paying school fees for her children. Her dream is to own a big dairy farm.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds for her cows.

loans.name: Noeun's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Noeun is 44 years old and widowed. She has six children to take care of and two of them are dependents and still in school. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for several years. Sometimes she works for others for a fee to better feed her children. The current business earns her about 22,900 KHR per day. Lack of sufficient water is the main challenge for her business. 

Noeun’s group consists of four members who are all female and she has been with VisionFund for two cycles. The past loans have helped her gradually improve her livings. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for gasoline and labor. She hopes to make healthy rice to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de Carmen de treinta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad granos básicos, pan, huevos, leche, jabón, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa que le ha permitido obtener las mejores ganancias, la tienda esta ubicada en su residencia en una colonia muy transitada de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela pero sus mejores clientes fijos son sus vecinos, todos la prefieren porque posee la tienda mas surtida, con productos de calidad, y a precios accesibles, además de un excelente servicio; María es una mujer enérgica, decidida, humilde y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta luchando por ganarse un futuro mejor, su mas grande secreto es el amor a su trabajo sabe que solo así y con esfuerzo podrá lograr el éxito que tanto desea,  como toda buena comerciante desea acrecentar el negocio pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, pan, golosinas, bebidas, producto instantáneo, etc. María del Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María del Carmen, 33, lives with her life companion and their children in a house of her own.  She has a store where she sells basic staples like basic grains, bread, eggs, milk and soap, among others.  She’s been in business for several years and has acquired valuable experience that has led to the best profits.  The store is located at home in a neighborhood with many passersby.  She already has a large clientele but her best, regular customers are her neighbors who prefer her because she has the best stocked store with quality products at accessible prices plus provides excellent service.

María is an energetic, determined, humble woman who is dedicated to her work; she’s always striving to attain a better future.  Her greatest secret is the love for her work; she knows that only in that way will and with great effort will she attain the success she so desires.

Like all good merchants, she wants to expand her business but lacks sufficient capital to do so which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy basic grains, bread, snacks, beverages, instant products, etc.  María del Carmen has good payment references and unblemished morals.  She assures that she will be able to repay the loan while at the same time she trusts that she will provide her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jogie

texts.en:
Jogie is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He has two dependents who sometimes accompany him in roaming around various communities buying rusted or used metal items to sell. He has been doing this for three years. He gets 3,500 PHP a month from this activity. 

Jogie joined GDMPC in 2011. He is applying for a loan of 4,000 PHP from the organization to procure recycled items to sell. The revenue will be used to expand business operations and sustain daily needs.

loans.use: to procure recycled items to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 47 years old and is married to Fernando, a father who is involved in the farming business. They live in the village of Carabatan Chica with their children. To help her husband, Edna is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been in this business for almost 7 years and earns about a net income of 2,500 PHP per piglet. At this time, Edna is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy hog feed and vaccines for her hogs. She believes that through her loan, she will be able to maintain the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Jackieline

texts.en: Hog-raising is the primary source of income for the family of Jackieline. She is 39 years old and is married with three children. Her spouse's name is Nelson. He is a responsible father who is busy managing their farmland. Jackieline is willing to do everything to meet the needs of her family. Right now, Jackieline wants to have more piglets to raise, that is why Jackieline is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy feed, vaccines and an additional hog to raise. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to secure the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and an additional hog to raise

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Abelina; la socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos, la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que mas le solicitan como restaurantes y ferias ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Introducing Abelina, a member of "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata", a Communal Bank located in Yuncaypata, a community of the province and department of Cusco.

Abelina keeps on breeding small animals such as “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig), hens and pigs. She breeds these animals to then sell them to those among her customers that mostly request them, such as restaurants and fair retailers. She has been engaged in this activity for many years and things are going well thanks to the determination she daily works with. Abelina is a responsible and persevering person, as though this activity she provides for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy cuyes for her activity.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayments of her dues.

loans.use: To buy cuyes for her activity.

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de Encarnación,  trabajan con la fundación hace varios años,  gracias a su esfuerzo y gran dedicación ya están en el ciclo numero 24.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Mariela, ella se dedica a la administración de la cantina del colegio que se encuentra en su barrio, y cuenta que tiene mucha venta y que gracias a la ayuda de su grupo y de fundación paraguaya esta saliendo adelante.
La Sra. Mariela solicita el crédito para surtir la cantina con comestibles, bebidas, golosinas y demás para la elaboración de las comidas que se venden en la cantina,  ella se encuentra  muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
This group is from Encarnación.  They’ve worked with the Fundación for several years.  Thanks to their effort and great dedication they are now in cycle #24.

One of the group members is Mariela.  She manages the canteen at a school in her neighborhood and she relates that sales are very good and thanks to her group’s and Fundación Paraguaya’s help she’s getting ahead.

Mariela is requesting the loan to stock her canteen with foodstuffs, beverages, snacks and others to make the dishes she sells in the canteen.  She’s very grateful for the opportunity she’s getting.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, beverages, snacks and others.

loans.name: Teodolinda Yanyleth

texts.es: Teodolina Yanyleth de veintiocho años de edad vive junto a sus padres, ella posee un chalet donde vende productos alimenticios como panes, bebidas , golosinas, entre otros, esta ubicada en un colegio de la comunidad donde reside, tiene varios años con su pequeño negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite alcanzar muy buenas ganancias, comercia para todos los estudiantes, ellos la prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Teodolina es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le den un futuro mas prospero, por lo que día a día se esfuerza al máximo para alcanzar su objetivo, en las ultimas semanas en la hora del recreo de los estudiantes aumento la demanda y quiere realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pan, embutidos, frutas, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Teodolina Yanyleth tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teodolina Yanyleth, 28, lives with her parents.  She has a snack bar where she sells food items like bread, beverages and snacks, among others, located in a local school.  She’s had this small business for several years and she’s attained quite a bit of sales experience that leads to her earning good profits.  She sells to all the students and they prefer her because everything she sells is top quality at affordable prices with excellent service above all.  

Teodolina is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work.  She’s always on the lookout for alternatives that will lead to a more profitable future which is why she strives daily to the maximum degree to reach her objective.

In recent weeks student demand at recess  has increased and she wants to make a new investment but lacks sufficient capital to do so which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy bread, canned goods, fruit, snacks, beverages, etc.  Teodolina Yanyleth has good payment references and is very responsible.  She assures that she will be able to repay the loan and has faith that she’ll provide better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, fruit, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Avelina; la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada  dia a su negocio,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas entre otros,la socia continua tambien vendiendo hierbas medicinales en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco en las ferias sabatinas,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  más mercadería como leche y azucar.

La socia está agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Avelina, a member of "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata", a Communal Bank located in Yuncaypata, a community of the province and department of Cusco.

Avelina keeps on running her grocery store. She has been engaged in this activity for many years and things are going well thanks to the determination she daily works with. She sells different kinds of products such as rice, sugar, milk and snacks. Avelina also keeps on selling herbal medicines in one of the markets of the city of Cusco in the Saturday fairs. Avelina is a responsible and persevering person, as though this activity she provides for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy more products such as milk and sugar.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayments of her dues.

loans.use: To buy milk and sugar.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité San Cayetano nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral.
La Sra. Mirtha, presidenta del grupo tiene 27 años, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora  y capaz de liderar un grupo numeroso como lo es este, ella se dedica a las ventas  varias y solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, fideos, carne, leche, panificados, arroz, bebidas, aceite, harina, con lo que podrá seguir vendiendo y cumpliendo con sus clientes.
Ellas están contentas por la ayuda que reciben pues les será de mucha ventaja para seguir en sus negocios y ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The “San Cayetano” committee arose thanks to the initiative of a group of women who were working in said place.  This committee is from the city of San Lorenzo and the members set their individual and work growth as their main goal.

Mirtha, 27, is group president.  She’s a very enterprising woman capable of leading such a large group as this one.  She's in general sales and requests the loan to buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, beverages, oil and flour to continue selling and meeting customer demand.

They are happy for the support they are getting because it will be very advantageous for them in order to stay in business and help their families.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, beverages, oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.es:
El  Sr. Emigdio tiene 53 años y está casado con la Sra. Victorina de 49 años, tienen 6 hijos, por quienes esta pareja han luchado siempre para poder darles una buena educación y que no tengan que privarse de nada.
El Sr. Emigdio se dedica desde hace 30 años al fraccionamiento y venta de carbón vegetal. Su producto lo compra de diferentes ciudades del interior del país  y los vende fraccionado en bolsas de distintas clases.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mayor cantidad de carbón para obtener de esa  manera  menor precio de costo por su producto y mayor ganancia para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Emigdio, 53, is married to Victorina, 49, and they have six children.  This couple strives always to give their children a good education and to insure that their needs are met.

Emigdio has been working for the last 30 years braking up and selling vegetable charcoal.  He buys the product in various cities in the interior of the country and sells it broken up in various sized bags.

He requests the loan to buy larger amounts of charcoal so that he can buy it at a better price and earn higher profits to continue helping his family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Abd Allah

texts.en: Abd Allah is a 23-year-old single man from Sahab, Jordan.  He is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD in order to pay for his university tuition so that he can continue his education.  In the future, he hopes to improve his socioeconomic status.  Since Abd Allah is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Epifania;la socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta  de asnapa (hierbas),la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia compra su mecaderia en la provincia  de Urubamba para luego venderlo en las ferias sabatinas en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco,la socia a la vez tambien continua dedicandose a la agricultura sembrando papa,maiz,trigo entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 


La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y abono para su chacra.

La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Introducing Epifania, a member of "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata", a Communal Bank located in Yuncaypata, a community of the province and department of Cusco.

Epifania keeps on running her activity, buying and selling asnapa (a herb). She has been engaged in this activity for many years, and things are going well thanks to the determination she daily works with. She buys her products in the Urubamba province to then sell them in the Saturday fairs in one of the markets of the town of Cusco. She also keeps on engaging in agriculture, planting potatoes, corn and wheat. Epifania is a responsible and persevering person, as though this activity she provides for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and manure for her small farm.

She is grateful for the loan and she commits to complying with the repayments of her dues.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure for her small farm.

loans.name: Reina De Jesus

texts.es:
Reina, está decidida a continuar trabajando en la venta de mariscos, para esto ella considera que es necesario realizar una nueva compra para aumentar el producto fresco, en camarones, en lonja al tiburón, pescado de varias especies, este prestamo le dará la solvencia económica para realizar compras periódicas.

Con el préstamo anterior logró realizar una buena inversión, tuvo un efecto positivo en cuanto a las ventas y ganancias, en su familia se han mantenido estables las condiciones, ha logrado satisfacer las necesidades más urgentes y realizar la compra de los bienes del hogar.
texts.en:
Reina is determined to continue working selling seafood and to do so she feels it’s necessary to make a new purchase of fresh product: shrimp, a slice of shark and fish of various species.  This loan will give her the economic solvency to make periodic purchases.

She managed to make a good investment with her previous loan.  She obtained a positive result with respect to sales and profits.  Her family has maintained itself in stable conditions and she’s succeeded in meeting her most urgent needs and to buy assets for the home.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, a slice of shark and various species of fish.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, necesita invertir en el cultivo de maíz que realiza por esta temporada, conprandose abono, herbicidas, para que el cultivo de maíz y frijol le de una cosecha adecuada, espera de los resultados poder continuar ayudando a su familia para la alimentación y al mismo tiempo poder vender  parte de la cosecha para generar ingresos.

El manifiesta que el crédito anterior le dio la compra del insumo agrícola para aplicarlo a una cosecha anterior, hasta el momento ha continuado apoyando su familia, en lo personal considera que ha avanzado en la Universidad acercándose más a su objetivo de superación.
texts.en:
Orlando needs to invest in this season’s corn crops buying manure and herbicide so that his corn and bean crops will produce adequate yields.  He hopes with good results to be able to continue helping with his family’s food needs while also being able to sell part of the harvest to generate income.

He states that the previous loan made it possible for him to buy farm supplies to apply to his previous crop.  To date, he has continued to support his family and he believes on a personal level that he’s made progress at the university and is getting nearer his goal of self-improvement.

loans.use: to buy manure and  herbicide.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 40-year-old married female from Al Hashmi in Jordan. She has 4 children and has requested a 600 JOD loan to buy cosmetics, clothes, and blankets for resale. She is planning to buy goods from Aqaba and sell them to her neighbors. 

Sarah is looking forward to improving the financial and social conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes and blankets for resale.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
El socio Rosendo pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA,el socio continua dedicandose a trabajar como maestro constructor,el socio trabaja para las distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios,el socio lleva años dedicandose a este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia ,el socio trabaja de forma independiente y esto le favorece ya que tiene mas tiempo para estar con su familia,el socio es una persona resposanble y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de herramientas que necesita como serruchos,martillos y otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Introducing Rosendo, a member of the "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata" Communal Bank. Rosendo keeps on working as master builder, working in the different building sites that request his services. He has been engaged in this activity for many years, and things are going well thanks to the determination he daily works with. He is an independent contractor, and this is good for him as he has more time to spend with his family. Rosendo is a responsible and persevering person, as though this activity he provides for his family.
The loan he is requesting will be used to buy tools he needs such as handsaws and hammers.
He is grateful for the loan and he commits to complying with the repayments of his dues.

loans.use: To buy handsaws and hammers.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cecilia, se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios de vestir, está casada y es madre de cuatro hijos, dos de ellos aún están menores de edad, tiene experiencia en el negocio y trabaja junto a su esposo, tienen puestos de venta distintos pero el la respalda trabajando los cinco días de la semana desde las siete hasta las cinco de la tarde.

Ella invertirá en la compra de más mercadería, para esto solicita un préstamo que le permita realizar la inversión comprando se ropa como blusas, ropa interior y al mismo tiempo aretes, collares y pulseras, esta inversión ayudará significativamente en el aumento de sus ventas, considerando que se acerca una temporada de fin de año en la cual aumenta la demanda.

Su sueño es tener un puesto más amplio más vistoso que le permita atraer más a la clientela, mayor crecimiento y desarrollo económico para ella y para su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia works selling clothing and clothing accessories.  She’s married and the mother of four children, two are still minors.  She has experience in the business and works with her husband.   They each have their own stand but he backs her up working five days a week from 7am until 5pm.

She will invest in the purchase of more merchandise and to do so needs a loan to buy clothes like blouses, underwear and also earrings, necklaces and bracelets too.  This investment will help her significantly to increase sales keeping in mind that the end-of-year season when demand increases is approaching.

Her dream is to have a larger, more attractive stand that will attract more customers; to have more economic growth and development for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, underwear, earrings, necklaces and  bracelets.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y comida, vive con su familia e hijos, este negocio lo aprendido por parte de su familia y trabaja todos los días de la semana desde las siete de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche, no tiene ninguna dificultad hasta el momento cuenta con tres años de experiencia.

Ella comprará mercadería como lo es frijol, maíz, arroz, azucar, condimentos y golosinas, esta inversión ayudará para mantener mejor el inventario, más surtido para atender a los clientes teniéndo a la mano lo necesario.

Su objetivo es poder crecer en el mercado y tener una tienda más amplia, contando con diversidad de productos de primera calidad, que le permita aumentar sus ingresos económicos para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Flor sells basic grains and food.  She lives with her family and children.  She learned this business from her family and works every day of the week from 7am until 7pm.  She’s had no difficulties and to date has three years’ experience.

She will buy merchandise like beans, corn, rice, sugar, condiments and snacks.  This investment will help her have a better stocked inventory for her customers having everything necessary on hand.  Her objective is to be able to grow in the marketplace and to have a larger store stocked with a variety of top quality products so that her income will grow and she will be able to help her children.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, condiments and snacks.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, se dedica al agricultura, vive con su esposa y su hijo, además realiza trabajos de albañilería, de estas ocupaciones ha logrado tener la solvencia económica para poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia.

Actualmente Mario está realizando la siembra de maíz, por eso solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar abono para aplicarlo al cultivo de maíz y poder fortalecerlo y aumentar la producción del cultivo.

La aspiración de él es a través de su trabajo pueda aportar su hogar todo lo necesario para la subsistencia y ayudar a su hijo al estudio.
texts.en:
Mario works in agriculture. He lives with his wife and son. He also does masonry work, and with these occupations has achieved the financial solvency to support the needs of his family. 

Right now Mario is planting corn, which is why he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to increase and strengthen the crop.

Through his work, he hopes to provide all their household needs, and to be able to help his son with his studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is from Maguikay, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.  She is 54 years old.  Marilyn is married and has five children. 

To make a living, Marilyn runs a general store and sells a variety of food and household products in the local community.  Marilyn has been in business for two years and earns 8,000 PHP each month for these activities.

Marilyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  Recently, Marilyn joined GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Rosaura Isabel

texts.es:
Rosaura, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral, es una persona reconocida de la comunidad, es responsable y trabajadora, actualmente vive con dos hijos son dependíentes económicamente de ella, Rosaura está dedicada a las actividades agropecuarias como la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral, este trabajo lo prendió en su vivienda por la necesidad de mejorar y tener una fuente de ingreso a su familia, la ventaja es que los clientes llegan a su hogar para adquirir los animales, no es necesario transportarse para poder venderlos.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y pagar mano de obra, para finalizar la construcción de un corral para los cerdos, este prestamo ayudará a fortalecer el negocio manteniendo mejor a los cerdos en un lugar más adecuado, con el aseo necesario, ya que están alejados del hogar sin tener riesgo de una posible enfermedad.

Su sueño es tener una buena cantidad de cerdos en el corral, para poderlos engordar y luego poderlos vender, generara más ingresos económicos a su hogar y a su familia para que posean una mejor alimentación.
texts.en:
Rosaura works raising pigs and barnyard fowl.  She’s well-known in her community; she’s responsible and hardworking.  She currently lives with two children who are economically dependent on her.  Rosaura works in animal husbandry activities like raising pigs and barnyard fowl.  She set up this activity at home because she needed to improve and have a source of family income.  Her advantage is that customers come to her house to acquire the animals so she does not have to go anywhere else to sell them.

She requests a loan to buy bricks, cement and sand and to pay labor costs to finish building a corral for the pigs.  This loan will help her strengthen the business by being able to house the pigs in a more adequate space that includes the required cleanliness because they will be at a distance from her house and safe from any risk of possible illness.

Her dream is to have a good number of pigs in her corral to fatten them up and then sell.  She will generate more household and family income so that they can be better fed.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Sochat's Group

texts.en:
Sochat is 34 years old.  He is married with four children, three of whom are dependents and still in school, and lives in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province.  To support his family, he has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland for 20 years and supplements his family’s income by raising pigs.  Now he has two pigs to raise.  From his current business, he can earn about 36,000 KHR per day and can save about 14,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is the group loan for Sochat’s Group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  This is Sochat’s second loan cycle while his group member is with VisionFund just this loan cycle.  The first loan has helped Sochat better support his family.  Now he and his group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each.  As the group leader, he wants to use one portion of the loan to buy kitchenwares, such as bowls and cooking pots, and use the other portion of it to buy a bed for his family.  With this loan, he hopes to acquire sufficient household necessities for his family to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a bed and kitchenware.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn, 25 years old, lives with her husband and child in their village and is generating income through her hog-raising business. Analyn aims to save for the future education of her child.
