 Analyn is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy additional pigs to raise and sell in the future. She believes that the loan will enhance her business, leading to a higher income upon sale of the hogs that will help to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Pilar, está en el ciclo 9 donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de respeto y de ayuda mutua y se ayudan las unas a las otras.
Una historia es la de la Sr. Flavia quien se dedica a la venta de ropa esto gracias a los créditos que se le otorgó , nos comenta que mediante el  crédito  pudo mejorar su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar camisas, camisillas, pantalones y demás prendas para poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
The group Virgen del Pilar is in their 9th loan cycle They all work in an environment of respect and mutual support where they help each other.

One such story is that of Flavia, who sells clothes thanks to the loans that have been awarded. She tells us that by means of these loans, she has been able to improve her business, her quality of life and her income. 

She is requesting this loan to buy shirts, tank tops, pants and other garments to keep growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en:
Vuthy is aged 48 years and lives with his family members in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. He is married with five children, only two of whom are dependents, while the others have their own employment. 

Rice farming has been the only main source for his family’s income for twenty years. The current business earns him about 18,000 KHR per day and he manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Vuthy’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. Vuthy has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles while his group co-member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. He successfully used the loans from VisionFund to improve his family’s living condition and now he is confident to make a living better. 

Requesting a loan with VisionFund, Vuthy, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice healthily and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve his family’s life style and build on his savings to extend his farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Haydee De Jesus

texts.es: Haydee de Jesús de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; ella posee una venta de golosinas y fruta picada como piña, mango, guayaba, jocotes, entre otros; tiene varios años con su pequeño negocio y ha adquirido valiosa experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia desde su residencia en una colonia muy transitada de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con su servicio excelente; Haydee es una mujer humilde, activa, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito y no piensa rendirse hasta lograrlo; en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión por lo que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permite comprar fruta por mayor y golosinas. Haydee tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Haydee de Jesús, 44, lives with her life companion and their children in a house of her own.  She sells snacks and diced fruit like pineapple, guava and mombin, among others.  She’s been in business for several years and has gained valuable sales experience that makes it possible for her to earn the best profits.  She sells from home in a neighborhood that has many passersby.  She has many customers and people prefer her because everything she sells is top quality at affordable prices with excellent service.

Haydee is a humble, active woman who is dedicated to her work and who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s always on the lookout for new opportunities that will make it possible for her to attain success and she does not plan to rest until she reaches it.

In recent weeks demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy fruit at wholesale and snacks.  Haydee has good payment references and is very responsible.  She assures that she will be able to repay the loan while at the same time trusts that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit and snacks at wholesale.

loans.name: Balmoris

texts.es:
Balmoris, tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa y un hijo de un año de edad, administra un taller de carpintería desde hace cuatro años, este taller lo aprendió a administrar con su padre, quien le enseñó a crear los muebles de madera, actualmente lo atiende a tiempo completo.

Esta solicitando préstamos para comprarse varios tipos de madera para poder aumentar el inventario y a la mano tener lo necesario como madera de aceituno, cedro, pino, esto le ayudará para que él pueda realizar su trabajo sin tener contratiempos.

Su aspiración es ampliar el taller como una sala de venta grande, especializarse en realizar trabajos con tabla roca, ya que sería un ingreso adicional del cual pudiera generar.
texts.en:
Balmoris, 33, lives with his wife and one-year-old son.  He’s been managing his carpentry shop for four years.  He learned how to manage the shop with his father who taught him to make wood furniture.  He currently works in it full-time.

He’s requesting loans to buy several types of wood to increase inventory and have on hand things he needs like olive, cedar and pine woods.  This will help him to do his work with no setbacks.

His hope is to expand the shop into a large salesroom and specialize in sheetrock jobs because that would be an additional source of income he could generate.

loans.use: to buy cedar, pine and olive woods.

loans.name: Jose Inocente

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón vive con su familia, sus padres y sus hermanos, está soltero y nadie depende económicamente de él, en su hogar todos trabajan para poder aportar a las diferentes necesidades. El aprendió de sus padres a realizar la venta semilla de marañon, ya que en su familia todos trabajan en el mismo negocio, no tiene un horario establecido para realizar las ventas.

Ello solicita un préstamo para comprarse 40 medidas de semilla de marañón equivalentes a 1200 libras, éstas serán procesadas azandolas para luego prepararlas empacarlas las para la venta, esta compra le permitiera tener en su negocio la suficiente cantidad de semilla para continuar en la venta.

Su objetivo es a futuro tener casa propia y poder crear su propio hogar, aumentar el negocio y al mismo tiempo sus ganancias.
texts.en:
José works selling cashew nuts.  He lives with his family: his parents and siblings.  He’s single and no one depends economically on him but at home everyone works to contribute towards covering the various needs.  He learned to sell cashew nuts from his parents because everyone in the family works in the same business; he has no set schedule to do his sales.

He’s requesting a loan to buy 40 measures of cashew nuts that equal 1,200 pounds.  They will be processed (roasted) and then packaged for sale.  This purchase will allow him to have sufficient quantity of nuts on-hand to continue with his sales.  His future objective is to have a house of his own to be able to create his own family and to increase business and profits at the same time.

loans.use: to buy 40 measures of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Jessica Massiel

texts.es: La joven Jessica de 24 años de edad, actualmente trabaja como impulsadora para una empresa privada, estudiante de la carrera de licenciatura en administración de empresas, quien cubre sus estudios con su salario mensual de 48 horas laborables a la sema. Ella solicita apoyo de crédito para pagar el curso de titulación ya que su salario es muy bajo y no le da para pagar de un solo el curso, para ella es muy importante terminar su profesión para desempeñarse en su carrera y con el tiempo formar su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Jessica is 24 years old, currently working as saleswoman for a private company. She is studying a university degree of Business Administration. She covers her studies with her monthly salary of 48 hours per week. 

She is requesting a loan to pay for her course degree because her salary is very low and it isn't enough to pay for her course at once. It's very important for her to finish her profession to serve in her career and eventually start her own business.

loans.use: to pay for her the course degree.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, está soltera tiene un hijo de 22 años de edad que depende económicamente de sus ingresos, ella a través de este negocio ha logrado cubrir las necesidades del hogar y día a día realizar las ventas, ya tiene los clientes definidos a quienes todos los días les ofrece la mejor calidad de tortillas.

Solicita un préstamo para comprarse leña y también maíz, comprando por mayor cantidad ya que le permite obtener un mejor precio de los proveedores y de esta manera poder seleccionar un mejor margen de ganancia, el préstamo ayudará para que su negocio esté con lo necesario para realizar la venta.

Su aspiración es mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y de ella, aumentando sus ventas, sus ganancias y la posibilidad de continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Gregoria works selling tortillas.  She’s single and has a 22-year-old son who depends economically on her income.  By means of this business she’s been able to cover basic household expenses and to do her sales every day.  She has regular customers to whom she offers the best quality tortillas every day.

She’s asking for a loan to buy firewood and corn in large amounts because she gets better prices from suppliers that way and she can generate a larger profit margin that way too.  The loan will help her have everything she needs on-hand for her business to do her sales.  Her hope is for a better quality of life for her and her son, to increase sales and profits and to be able to continue to work.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, está casada y tiene tres hijos de las edades de 16, 20 y 27 años, la señora realiza la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace cinco años, todos los días de la semana desde de las cinco de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde.

Actualmente necesita realizar la inversión en frutas y verduras frescas como lo son tomates, papas, chiles, manzanas, papayas, entre otras verduras y frutas que son necesarias para que el negocio continúe vendiendo, este préstamo ayudará a fortalecer y ayudará para que tenga la seguridad de continuar en el negocio.

Su aspiración es poder formar a su hijo el más pequeño con una carrera académica, que le permita tener mejores oportunidades de superación, también con el negocio espera mantener un nivel adecuado de ventas en ingresos para cubrir los gastos cotidianos.
texts.en:
Rosa sells fruits and vegetables. She is married and has three children, ages 16, 20 and 27. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for five years, every day of the week from five in the morning until five in the afternoon. 

Currently, she needs to invest in fresh fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, peppers, apples, papayas and other fruits and vegetables that are necessary for the business to continue selling. This loan will help strengthen and help so she can have the security to continue the business. 

Her hope is to be able to educate her youngest son with academic courses, which will allow him to have better opportunities for advancement. With the business, she also hopes to maintain adequate sales and income to cover living expenses.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, peppers, apples and papayas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Rabiha

texts.en:
Rabiha is a 30-year-old married woman from Sahab Jordan who supports four family members.   

She is requesting a loan of JD 400 to buy children's and women's clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors in the area where she would like to expand her project. She wants to open a shop to show her products, and she hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: María Inés de sesenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a sus hijos y su nuera en casa propia; ella posee una pupusería desde hace ya varios años y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en la elaboración y venta, gracias a eso tiene las mejores ganancias, comercia desde su residencia y es muy conocida en toda la comunidad pues prepara las pupusas mas exquisitas, además los clientes la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y el excelente servicio; María es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y muy luchadora, día a día se esfuerza  por obtener un futuro mejor, su mas grande secreto es el esfuerzo y el amor a su trabajo sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito que tanto que desea; en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar quesillo, chicharrón, granos básicos, verduras, etc. María Inés tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Inés, 64, lives with her children and daughter-in-law in her own house.  She’s owned a pupusa [filled, grilled corncake] shop for several years now and has gained quite a bit of experience making and selling them thanks to which her profits are the best.  She sells from home and is well-known throughout the community because she makes the most delicious pupusas.  Besides customers prefer her because of the quality, food prices and excellent service.

María is a woman who is dedicated to her work; she’s energetic and very tenacious.  Day to day she strives to have a better future.  Her greatest secret is her effort and love of work.  She knows that this is the only way to attain the success she so desires.  

In recent weeks demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment but lacks sufficient capital to do so which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy string cheese, pork, basic grains, vegetables, etc.  María Inés has good payment references and is very responsible.  She assures that she will be able to repay the loan while at the same time has the hope that she will provide her family with improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy string cheese, fried pork, basic grains and vegetables.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, es un artesano y está en proceso de sembrar maíz, por eso se decidió a continuar trabajando con préstamos para comprarse abono y herbicidas, que los aplicara  a la siembra para que esta produzca mejor y además evite las plagas, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para realizar la agricultura.

El comenta que el préstamo anterior le sirvió para poder crear ingresos y subsistir con su familia, a través de su trabajo fabricando artesanías de Tule, considera que esta actividad al igual que la agricultura le sirven para poder generar a su familia los recursos necesarios para los gastos.
texts.en:
Juan is an artisan and is in the process of planting corn which is why he decided to continue working with loans to buy manure and herbicide to apply to his crops so that they will produce better and avoid infestations.  The loan will be of great help for him to do the farming.

He comments that his previous loan helped him create income and subsist with his family.  He believes that by means of his work making crafts out of the wood of the giant cypress tree and the work he does in agriculture he’s able to generate income to provide his family with the necessary resources to meet cover expenses.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena, age 50, has operated a snack vending business for eight years. She truly enjoys her work and earns PHP 3,500 per month from her business. She and her husband have two grown children and live in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

In 2007, Nena joined GDMPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 from the cooperative to purchase snack items to vend. She hopes to improve the business and offer more items for sale.

loans.use: to purchase snack items to vend.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Aged 39 years, Thy is a married mother of four children living in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Out of her children, two are dependent on her. 

She is a rice farmer and sometimes sells snacks to gain extra income, while her husband is a paid worker. She has been in the business for twenty years and she can earn about 21,000 KHR per day and can save about 16,000 KHR each day. 

This is the third loan for Thy’s group of two. She completely paid back the first two loans, which have helped her better support her family. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy a plot of farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice production to increase her family’s income. She hopes to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Jennhy Beatriz

texts.es: Jennhy de 32 años de edad, vive junto a su madre y dos hijos pequeños por quienes trabaja muy duro y brindarles todo lo mejor. Jennhy se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada la cual ofrece en su casa de habitación, así mismo para obtener ganancias extras, ella sale a vender a diferentes pueblos y municipios del país. Jennhy solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL con el fin de contar con el capital necesario para invertir en la compra de más ropa para diferentes personas, ya sea formal, casual o informal. Para ella lo principal es aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ganancias para contar con una vida tranquila y feliz junto a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Jennhy, age 32, lives with her mother and her two young children. She works very hard in order to provide the best for them. Jennhy sells new and used clothing from her home. To generate extra income, she also sells in different towns and cities within the country.

Jennhy is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can have the necessary capital to invest. She will buy more formal, casual, and informal clothing for different people. Her main priorities are to increase her sales and improve her earnings so that she can have a peaceful and happy life with her daughters.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia Jeannette

texts.es:
Cecilia, necesita invertir en su negocio y a la vez legalizar escritura publica de su casa de habitación, por eso ella esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, el cual le ayudara en la compra de granos básicos, aceite, carnes, mariscos, bebidas para su negocio y gastos notariales para la legislación de la escritura publica de su casa.
Ella nos comenta que el préstamo anterior le permitio mantenerse en su negocio logrando la fidelidad de sus clientes, ella sigue con su negocio mejorando económicamente para el mantenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia needs to invest in her business and at the same time legalize the public deed of her house. She is requesting a loan again, which will help her with the purchase of basic grains, oil, meat, seafood, and drinks for her business and notary fees for the legislation of the public deed of her house.

She says that the previous loan allowed her to stay in business, achieving customer loyalty. She continues with her business, improving economically for the maintenance of her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, seafood, and drinks.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 41, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, a driver, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evelyn hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nerie

texts.en:
Nerie's main source of income comes from her gardening business. She is 47 years old, widowed, and has four children. She is from Bayabas, Aurora and been two years in gardening, earning an amount of PHP 3,000 a month. 

In 2009, Nerie joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Khim is aged 53 years and a mother of two children. One child is dependent and still in school whilst the other is employed and earning a living. For the last thirty years, Khim has been working as a rice farmer to support her family. 

Khim has been a member of VisionFund for six cycles already and she completely paid back the loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has been able to better support her business and family’s living condition. Now she can earn about US$10 per day from her current business and save about US$5 each day for future needs. Now requesting another loan of US$500, she wants to use this loan to buy a cow for her farming business, and also to use a portion of it to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a cow as labor in helping her farming business, and also hopes to increase rice yields so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a cow for her farming business

loans.name: Socheata

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Socheata is 28 and married with four children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. For the last five years, she has been farming rice as her primary business, while her husband is a soldier. The current business earns her about US$10 per day to make a living and she can save about US$5 each day for future needs. 

This is the first loan for Socheata with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now requesting a loan of US$1,000, she is going to use it to buy house construction materials such as sand, wood, brick etc. With this loan, she hopes to finish her house completely for living in.

loans.use: To buy house construction materials

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura y crianza de animales,la socia cria chanchos,ovejas y vacas,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y la socia tambien tiene terrenoe de cultivo donde siembra papa,maiz y verduras,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chanchos,ovejas y vacas.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to engage in farming and raising animals. She raises pigs, sheep, and cows. After they are grown and fattened, the animals are sold at different fairs. The borrower also has a plot of land on which she grows potatoes, corn, and vegetables. She has been in business for five years and has done very well. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy pigs, sheep, and cows.

The borrower appreciates and values the loan being provided in this manner. She promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner, just as she did with her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy pigs, sheep, and cows.

loans.name: Pey

texts.en:
Pey is 55 years old, and she lives in a rural village in the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. She is a married mother of six children, one of whom is dependent on her while the others have their own employment. 

For the past 20 years, Pey has been farming rice to make a living.  She can farm twice a year, while her husband runs a car taxi to earn additional income. Together, they can earn about US$26 per day from the current business and can save about US$8 each day for future needs. 

This is Pey's first loan from Kiva partner, VisionFund.  Pey is requesting a loan of US$400, which she will use to buy a plot of farm land for her business. This loan will enable her to extend her farm land, and she hopes to make more rice to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farm land for her business.

loans.name: Margery

texts.en:
This is Margery, who is 34 years old and a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Virgilio, a driver, and mother to her children. She manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Margery operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and resell it for a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and like products. Customers are attracted to buy because of her low selling prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Margery hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams of giving a beautiful future to her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ready-to-wear products and merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Los Siervos De Jesus Group

texts.es: La Sra. Alejandra tiene 47 años de edad, es separada y tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, tiene 7 años como clienta de Edaprospo, y como actividad principal trabaja de concesionaria en un colegio particular; además se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la línea Esika, Avon y Unique, con el cual ya tiene 25 años realizando estas ventas. Alejandra comenzó con la idea de vender estos productos de belleza para aumentar sus ingresos ya que no le alcanzaba el dinero para cubrir sus gastos. Actualmente con su esfuerzo y trabajo puede solventar los gastos en su hogar, y puede pagar las deudas que tiene pendientes. Anteriormente era ama de casa pero la necesidad de su familia la motivo a realizar esas ventas. Ella usó el préstamo en la compra de más productos como queques, galletas, piqueos  y diversos adornos que venderá en el puesto que tiene dentro del colegio. Alejandra pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Los Siervos de Jesús” el cual esta conformado por 5 personas y lleva más de 1 año como presidenta del grupo. Ella es la persona ubicada al lado izquierdo de la foto vestida con una blusa de color blanco.
texts.en: Alejandra is 47 years old, separated, and has two adult children.  She has been a client of Edaprospo for seven years and works selling food in a private school.  She also sells Esika, Avon and Unique brand cosmetics.  She has been making these sales for 25 years.  Alejandra started out with the idea of selling these beauty products in order to increase her income because she didn't have enough money to cover her expenses.  As a result of her efforts and hard work, she is now able to cover her household expenses and is able to pay off any debts that she has.  In the past, she was a housewife but she started making these sales because she had to meet her family's needs. She used the loan to purchase cakes, cookies, snacks and ornaments that she will sell inside the school.  Alejandra is a member of the 'Los Siervos de Jesús' (Servants of Jesus) community bank which has five members.  She has been the group's president for more than one year.  She is the person sitting on the far left of the photo, wearing a white blouse.

loans.use: purchase of cakes, cookies, snacks and various ornaments for students

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Sreymom is a 29-year-old mother of three dependent children. To support her children, Sreymom has been farming rice for seven years while her husband has been working as a motor-taxi driver for three years. Together, they can earn about US$10 per day and can save about US$4 each day for future needs.

Sreymon received her first loan two cycles ago and she completely repaid the loans with VisionFund. With the loans from VisionFund, she has been able to better support her livings and renovate her old house. Now applying for another loan of US$500, she will use this loan to buy a decent motorbike for her husband’s business. She hopes this loan will enable her husband to increase family’s income, thereby improving the family’s living conditions and sending their children to school.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike for her husband’s business

loans.name: Rochelyn

texts.en:
Rochelyn is 28 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. She is married with 1 child. 
Rochelyn has a motorcycle business and earns approximately PHP 5000 each month doing this type of work.
She has requested a loan to purchase a side car. 
Rochelyn has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Rochelyn hopes to financially support the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a side car

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is 31 years old and married, with two children. 

Rubilyn is engaged in a food-selling business. She primarily sells meat in their village. She has been in this business for three years and earns a net income of about PHP 1,500 a week. 

Right now, Rubilyn is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more meat to sell. She hopes to increase her income and hopes to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El señor Tomas ya ha tenido tres créditos con KIVA los cuales han sido para el mejoramiento de su negocio y a dado sus pagos puntalmente.
Es solicitando nuevamente un crédito ya que le esta haciendo falta algunas piezas y compara aparatos eléctricos para reparar y venderlos.
El señor Tomas es originario del estado de Veracruz, pero radica en esta ciudad desde hace mas de 20 años, los cuales se a dedicado a la reparación, compara y venta de aparatos eléctricos. Cuenta con un taller de reparación en su domicilio.
El señor Tomas cuanta con el un taller de reparaciones en su casa y con las ganancias que obtiene será para pagar el crédito.
Espera contar nuevamente con su cooperación en este préstamo y así poder invertir en su negocio.
texts.en: Tomas has now taken three loans with Kiva which have been to improve his business and he has paid all of them in a timely fashion.  He is seeking a new loan as he is in need of some electronics and their components to fix and sell the items in his store.  Tomas is originally from the state of Veracruz but has lived in this current city for more than 20 years, all of which he has made a living in electronics sales and repair.  He relies on his workshop that is run from his home and will use the proceeds from his business to repay the loan.  He counts on his coop to take out another loan so that he can keep investing in his business.

loans.use: to purchase electronics components

loans.name: Gs Palo Herrado Group

texts.es:
La señora Ester tiene 31 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive sus hijos y su esposo quien la respalda en cada uno de sus compromisos, su negocio es venta de tortillas actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años en su comunidad donde vive. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez es en grandes cantidades ya que esta en el centro de su lugar donde vive.
Doña Ester el crédito lo necesita para la compra de maíz, cal y leña. El impacto esperado con el crédito, es incrementar sus ventas ya que comprara una variedad de producto, para satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes.
Los planes a futuro de Doña Ester es seguir creciendo en su actividad, y generarse mejores ingresos para darles una mejor educación a sus hijos, como también una mejor calidad de vida.
Cecilia se dedica a prestar servicio de molino.
Lilian se dedica a la venta de mercadería usada clasificada.
Choluteca, Honduras - Septiembre del 2012
texts.en:
Ester is 31 years old. She lives in the southern zone of Honduras. Living together with her are her children and her husband, who supports her in every one of her commitments. Her business is selling tortillas, an activity she has carried out for three years in the community where she lives. Her business is located at a strategic point, where people pass by in great numbers, since it is in the center of the town where she lives. 

Ester needs the loan to buy corn, lime and firewood. The impact she hopes for from the loan is to increase her sales, since she will buy a variety of products to satisfy the needs of each of her customers. 

Ester's future plans are to continue growing in her work, and to generate a better income to give her children a better education and also a better quality of life. 

Cecilia works providing milling services.
Lilian works selling various categories of used merchandise. 
Choluteca, Honduras - September 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, lime and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is married, with three children.  He is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Ramil is operating a service business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for three years, and every month he earns PHP 3,000 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to repair his vehicle for better service.

Ramil been a member of GDMPC last 2011. In the future, Ramil hopes to pay for his children's studies and to double the income out from his business.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es casada y tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son independientes, viven en casa propia ocupando solo dos habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Alto Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja de forma independiente realizando diferentes trámites, ya sean legales o administrativos para sus clientes, por más de ocho horas al día, ya que debe ayudar con los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de ella y de su esposo.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento general de su vehículo particular ya que le sirve de transporte para el trabajo que realiza, pues debe movilizarse lo más rápido posible de un lugar a otro durante las horas de trabajo de los organismos públicos donde realiza los trámites.
El sueño de Carmen es mejorar sus ingresos y tener su propia oficina para captar más clientes y tener estabilidad laboral.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO  y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Carmen is married and has three children who are independent. They live in their own home, which only has two rooms. The house is located in the District of Alto Obrajes in the city of La Paz.

Carmen works independently at the moment by handling the paperwork, whether legal or administrative, for her clients. She works more than eight hours a day, which helps her pay the cost of food and basic services for herself and her husband. The loan she is requesting will be used for general maintenance of her personal vehicle that she uses in her work. This helps her to travel as quickly as possible from place to place during work hours to the various public entities where she must file paperwork.

Carmen’s dream is to improve her earnings and have an office of her own where she can attract more clients and have job security. This is the third time she has worked with IMPRO, but the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the maintenance costs of the vehicle she uses for work.

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es: Vilma Esperanza de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su familia; ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, posee en variedad camisas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia de forma ambulante y desde su hogar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y con un servicio excelente; Vilma es una mujer emprendedora y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta luchando por lo que desea y no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzar el éxito que se merece, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Vilma esperanza tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Vilma Esperanza is 48 years old and lives with her family. She is dedicated to selling clothing for women, men, and children. Vilma offers a variety of shirts, skirts, dresses, and pants, among other things. She has spent various years in her business and this has given her much experience,  permiting her to obtain the best earnings. Vilma sells her goods in the streets and from her home. She has built up a large clientele, since people prefer her because she always has what they need at accessible prices, with quality products and excellent service.

Vilma is an enterprising woman, very dedicated to her work. She is always battling for what she wants and never thinks of surrendering until she reaches the success she deserves. During recent months, demand has increased and Vilma wants to take advantage, making a new investment. But she lacks the capital she needs for this. 

Consequently, she is requesting, through INTEGRAL, a loan allowing her to buy clothing at wholesale. Vilma comes with good references for repayment and is very responsible. She is certain of repaying the debt and at the same time, confident that the investment will bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: purchase clothing at wholesale to sell in the streets.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María, continua trabajando en la elaboración de comales y ollas, solicita el préstamo porque necesita comprar más materia prima para seguir fabricando las artesanías, además se comprara leña y los materiales como nacazcol, barro, este préstamo le ayudara para que pueda comprarse los materiales necesarios para continuar en su trabajo, del cual depende con su familia.

Ella está muy contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de trabajo que se le brinda con los prestamos, ya que de esta manera es como a mejorado en algunos aspectos la vivienda, ha construido un horno y con techo para protegerlo de la lluvia, su hijo tiene problemas en una de sus manos y esta realizándole terapias, de esta manera piensa que los prestamos le ayudan a seguir para delante.
texts.en:
María continues working making griddles and pots. She is applying for a loan because she needs to buy more raw materials in order to continue making handicrafts and also she will buy firewood and supplies such as nacazcol (a type of dye) and clay. This loan will help so she can buy the necessary supplies in order to continue in her work, which her family depends on.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity of working that is offered by the loans, as this is the way she can improve some aspects of her housing. She has built a kiln with a roof to protect it from the rain. Her son has problems with one of his hands and receives therapy. She thinks that the loans are helping her get ahead.

loans.use: to buy nacazcol (a type of dye), clay, and firewood so she can make griddles and pots to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Marilu

texts.es: Sandra Marilú de treinta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo; ella posee una venta de ropa usada para damas, caballeros y niños, además comercia peluches y zapatos para complementar los gastos del hogar, se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas y eso le ayuda a obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia desde su vivienda y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad del producto, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Sandra es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan estar un paso mas cerca del éxito y no se rendirá hasta lograrlo por completo; en las ultimas semanas  aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa usada por mayor, peluches y zapatos. Sandra Marilú tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Sandra Marilú, age 31, lives together with her life partner and child. She owns a business selling used clothing for women, men and children to help with household expenses. Furthermore she deals in stuffed animals and shoes. 

She has had a lot of experience in retail, and this helps her to earn better profits. She works from her home and already has a large client base that prefers her for the quality of her products, good prices, and above all her excellent service. 

Sandra is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and is very motivated to get ahead in life. She is always waiting for new opportunities that will let her get one step closer to success, and she won't give in until she's succeeded 100%. 

In recent weeks demand has increased and she wants to make the most of it by making a new investment. That's why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy used clothing wholesale, stuffed animals and shoes. Sandra Marilú has good payment references and irreproachable morals. She is confident that she will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time she has faith that it will give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy used clothing wholesale, stuffed animals and shoes.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in Battambang Province’s Thmor Koul district, Chorn is age 49 years old and married with six children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. For the last 30 years, he has been fishing to support his family, while his wife is a rice farmer. Together, they can earn about US $14 per day and can save about US $9 each day for future needs. The main challenge for his family’s business is lack of water to better support the rice farming. 

This is the first loan for Chorn with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now requesting a loan of US $1,000, he is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers and rice seed for his farmland. He will also use a portion of it to spend for plowing the land and buying pesticides. He hopes this loan will enable him to grow rice successfully and produce more rice so as to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seed for his farmland

loans.name: La Fe Group

texts.es: Leyla es  miembro del Grupo Solidario La Fe, tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en la municipalidad de su comunidad, ella es una persona agradable, trabajadora y respetuosa. Leyla inicio su negocio desde hace ocho años y actualmente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y carne de cerdo. Su horario de atención inicia por las mañanas de 7:00 a.m y culmina como a las 7:00 p.m. Leyla gracias a Dios es una persona sana, muy jovial, amable y su ventaja es que tiene mucha clientela. Ella solicita este préstamo para comprar productos de cosméticos como ser lociones, cremas, shampoo, entre otros y también lo invertirá en la compra de carne de cerdo. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá mantener su negocio surtido  y estará mejor económicamente. Su sueño es tener un negocio bien establecido y poder tener su local propio. Es su primer crédito en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Leyla is a member of the communal bank La Fe. She is 31 years old, married and has two children. He husband works for the municipality in her community. She is an agreeable person, hardworking and courteous.

Leyla started her business eight years ago and currently she works selling cosmetics and pork. Her workday begins at 7:00AM and finishes at 7:00PM.

Thanks to God, Leyla is a healthy person, very jovial, friendly and her advantage is that she has many customers. She is asking for this loan in order to buy cosmetics such as lotions, creams, shampoo, among others and to invest in the purchase of pork. With the help of this loan she can keep her business stocked and this will be better financially. Her dream is to have a well established business and to be able to have her own facility. This is her first loan with FAMA and she expects to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and pork in order to keep her business stocked.

loans.name: Tinatin

texts.en:
Tinatin is from Mtskheta District of East Georgia. She is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children (7 and 14 years old). The children go to the local school. Her husband works as an artisan and earns a monthly income. The family is involved in rural activities. 

Tinatin has been running her own sewing workshop for many years. She sews curtains, mattresses, blankets, wedding dresses and special order clothing for her customers. Tinatin works hard to make some savings and improve their living conditions. She requested a loan to buy sewing materials. Tinatin will purchase different colored fabrics, threads, buttons and zippers to offer better quality of service to her customers. The rest of the credit will be used for kitchen renovations. 

This loan will help Tinatin to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and renovate the kitchen

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a hard-working and industrious man. He is married and blessed with five children. His five children are still studying. His wife's business is buying and selling gasoline.

Omar currently is raising three sows and four hogs to be fattened. He would like to make his hogs healthy so he could sell them at a better price. So, he decided to apply for a loan of PHP 20,000, allowing him to buy the necessary hog feed and vitamins for their proper growth.

Omar believes that his business will continue to grow and obtain greater income for him to educate all his five children and provide their everyday basic needs.

loans.use: to buy necessary feed and vitamins for raising his pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Hog raising has been Jocelyn's business. She is 43 years old and married. Aside from her livestock business, she also owns three hectares of rice field and one hectare of corn farm. According to her, farming has been the primary source of income of her family.

Jocelyn wants to raise her hogs to be healthy and free from any diseases so that she can obtain an increased income and more loyal buyers. To make her dreams come true, she is seeking a loan of PHP 20,000 which will be used to buy livestock feed and vitamins for her hogs. She knows that someday she could be a better businesswoman provided that the lenders continue to support her financially.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and vitamins for raising her pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sarum's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Battambang province’s Ratanak Mondul district, Sarum is 32 years old and married with two children, who are still in school. To make a living, she has been planting red maize for six years as her primary business. Lack of working capital and insects are the main challenges for her family’s business. 

Sarum’s group consists of five members who live in the same village. She has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already and completely paid back the loans, which have helped better support her family’s living. Now she can earn about 60,000 KHR per day from the current business and can save about 35,000 KHR each day for future needs. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion to buy pesticides to better support her business. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy lives in Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He has been earning a living through proving transportation services for 5 years so as to support the needs of his two children. He gets an income of 10,000 PHP a month for this business. For a 40-year-old father, there’s nothing that can make him happier than to see his children successful in their studies. 

Without hesitation, Randy is borrowing the amount of 17,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair the transport vehicle used in his business and provide his children a better education. He joined GDMPC in 2009. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair the transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Merry Riza

texts.en:
Merry Riza is a primary school teacher who is married to a security guard. She is blessed with a healthy child. Merry Riza stands as both father and mother to her only child, because her husband's work location is in Manila. Despite her temporary situation as a single parent, she is still able to cover their everyday household expenses and maintain their farming business.

Merry Riza operates a livestock business. She has managed this kind of business for more than five years. Aside from this, she also has a rice and corn field. Merry would like to strengthen her livestock and farming business to be able to improve their financial stability and have comfortable living conditions someday. She would like to apply for a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for her 23 fattening hogs. She hopes to obtain this loan, so she can raise her hogs healthy to maturity. She knows that providing complete livestock supplies will result in better outcome for her raised hogs. Merry Riza is looking forward to the success of her livestock business.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed, vitamins and vaccines for raising hogs

loans.name: Samneang's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Samneang is a 40-year-old mother of two dependent children who are still in school. For the last ten years, she and her husband have been farming rice to make a living. The main challenge for her family’s business is lack of working capital to better support the business. 

This is a group loan for Samneang’s group of two and she and her group member have been members of VisionFund for six cycles. She successfully used the past loans to better support her family with sufficient foods and her children’s studies. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of KHR 1,400,000 each. She wants to use this portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to increase her family’s income to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald was born in Dobo 18 years ago. His father is a poor farmer in a very small village, part of Sumatra Island, Indonesia. With his six siblings, of course it is not enough with his father's income of only 500,000 IDR a month. Ronald’s dream is to be an expert in port officer administration. Because Indonesia is an archipelago country, he knows that there will be a lot of jobs in his country. 

When he heard about the Maritime Academy Nusantara in Cilacap, then he wished his dream to continue his education there could come true. Ronald asks your help to make his dream come true by using the loan from you, so he can help his parents to give an education for his other siblings, to make their life better in the future.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Khorn is 44 years old and married. She has two children and now they both have their own employment. To make a living, she has been working as a cleaner in a university in the local area for two years while her husband is a motor-taxi driver. Together, they can earn about 49,000 KHR per day and save about 19,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is a group loan for Khorn with VisionFund and she has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already. She completely paid back the loans, which have helped her better support her family. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of KHR 1,300,000 and KHR 1,400,000 respectively. She wants to use her portion to buy a decent motorbike for her husband’s business. She hopes this loan will enable her husband to have a decent motorbike to use to run his business and she hopes he will earn more income from the current business.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike for her husband’s business

loans.name: Gs Plaza Cabañas Group

texts.es:
La señora Elisa tiene 36 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo quien también es comerciante y la apoya en cada una de sus responsabilidades. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez es en grandes cantidades ya que esta en el centro de cuidad donde vive y esto hace que sea muy visitado.
Doña Elisa el crédito lo necesita para la compra de: pantalones, bikini, brasieles, camisetas, camisas, fajas, bóxer etc. el impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es que sus ventas se incrementen ya que comprara una variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, los cuales visitan su negocio muy seguido.
Los planes a futuro de Doña Elisa es seguir creciendo en su  actividad, al mismo tiempo generarse buenos ingresos para tener  una mejor calidad de vida tanto para ella como para su familia.
María Elodia de dedica a la venta de mercadería nueva.
Edith se dedica a la venta de mercadería usada y golosinas
Norma se dedica a la venta de mercadería nueva.

Choluteca, Honduras - Septiembre  2012
texts.en:
Señora Elisa is 36 years old. She lives in the southern region of Honduras with her two children and her husband. He is also a businessman and he supports her in every one of her responsibilities. Her business is located in a strategic spot where there is a lot of traffic, as it's in the center of the city where she lives and this makes it well visited. 

Doña Elisa needs the loan to buy: pants, bikinis, bras, undershirts, shirts, shapewear, boxer shorts, etc. The expected impact of the financing is for her sales to increase, as she will be buying a variety of products to satisfy the needs of her customers who visit her business often. 

Doña Elisa's plans for the future are to continue growing in her work, while at the same time earning a good income in order to have a better quality of life for herself and for her family. 

María Elodia sells new merchandise. 

Edith sells used merchandise and sweets. 

Norma sells new merchandise. 

Choluteca, Honduras - September 2012

loans.use: to buy pants, bikinis, bras, undershirts, shirts, shapewear, boxer shorts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ritchell

texts.en: Ritchell, 31 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Acad, Aurora with three children and is earning a living from her transport service business. It has been operating for almost two years now and she earns 6,000 PHP a month. To improve her business, she is borrowing the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit which she just joined in 2009 to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en: Rubelyn is from Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 25 years old and is married with 3 children. Rubelyn earns a living from her gardening business. Rubelyn has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Rubelyn joined GDMPC. Rubelyn is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal, is a  mother of three girls and lives in a rented home. Her husband has a water tank and distributes water by order to houses. She has started making embroidered covers and fabric to help her husband to support the family and improve their living conditions. She has applied for this loan to buy more thread and special fabric for embroidery in hopes of increasing her profits and one day open a small tailoring workshop.

loans.use: to buy more thread and special fabric for embroidery

loans.name: Kim Eab's Group

texts.en:
Kim Eab, 38, is a married mother living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She has five children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Sometimes they work for others to help generate income for the family. She is a hard-working farmer who grows rice and watermelon and sometimes works for others for a fee while her husband is a house builder. Together with hard work, they can earn about 64,000 KHR per day and save about 12,000 KHR each day for the future needs.

This is group loan for Kim Eab’s group of three who have been members of VisionFund for three cycles already. Kim Eab successfully used the past loans to gradually improve her family’s living standard. Now she and her group members are applying for a fourth loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing and laborers. She hopes to grow more rice and increase her family’s income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: 010221Thôn Hợp Tân- Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Luận is the leader of the Thôn Hợp Tân-Hoằng Phụ solidarity group, which consists of three members. She is 21 years old and married with no children. Her husband and she live in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

For the past four years Luận has made and sold fish sauce. A lack of money, however, has made it hard for her to grow her business.

This year Luận joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to its small loans. She has successfully repaid one loan and is now applying for a 15,930,000 VND loan to share with her group. She will use her portion to buy small fish and shrimp to make her fish sauce.

Luận hopes that in the future her enterprise will make enough money to provide for the children she hopes to have and maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy small fish and shrimp to make her fish sauce.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en: Brian is a single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as a creative man . He operates a retail store where he sells utensils such as Thermos flasks, plates, cups etc. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located within a busy market and his primary customers are local residents from the local area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be not enough stock to sell. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more utensils and tableware for selling. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more utensils and tableware to sell

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en: Teofila is 27 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two children. Teofila owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns PHP 7,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Teofila has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2011. Positively, she hopes to be able to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn, who is 49 years old, lives with her husband and three children in their village. She generates income through her hog-raising business. She aims to save for the future education of her children. Jenelyn is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 (Philippine Pesos) to buy feed and additional pigs to raise and sell in the future. She believes that the loan will enhance her business, leading to a higher income upon the sale of the hogs, which will help to support her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy feed and additional pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Mom is 42 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. For the past ten years, she and her husband have been farming rice on six hectares of farmland to make a living, and sometimes her husband works for others for a fee to earn extra income. The current business earns her about KHR 23,000 per day, and she can save about KHR 17,000 each day for her future needs. 

Mom’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. She has been with VisionFund for four cycles, and her group members have been with VisionFund for two cycles. She successfully used the past loans to gradually improve her living conditions. Now leading her group to apply for another loan, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for gasoline. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías tiene 23 años de edad, es un joven soltero y vive con sus padres en una casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Elías es un joven responsable. Se dedica a la agricultura. A su edad ya sabe negociar sus productos en los mercados mayoristas de las ciudades. 
Gracias a sus padres cuenta con 2 parcelas de terrenos donde produce plátanos y café. 
Tiene sus metas establecidas, quiere lograr una producción de frutos que le permitan ahorrar el dinero suficiente para realizar algún negocio y poder estudiar.
Por eso se esfuerza mucho en sus cultivos. Este año cosechó una buena cantidad de café. Ahora él se esforzará en la limpieza de su cafetal. Él cree conveniente, contratar personal para realizar la limpieza de sus cultivos, por eso requiere de su apoyo para pagar a estas personas y para comprar los fertilizantes. Éste es su crédito número 2 con MFP, por eso menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.  “Los productores Yaneshas”, es su banco comunal y se siente a gusto con sus socios.
Invertirá los 1500 soles en la compra de 15 bolsas de fertilizantes orgánicos para preparar sus cultivos de café y plátanos para próximas cosechas.
texts.en:
Elías is 23 years old. He is a single young man and lives with his parents in their own house, located in an indigenous community of the central forest. Elías is a responsible young man. He works in agriculture. At his age, he already knows how to broker his products in the wholesale markets of the cities. Thanks to his parents, he has two parcels of land where he produces bananas and coffee.

He has established his goals. He wants to achieve a production of fruit that will allow him to save sufficient money to have some type of business and be able to go school.

For this reason, he puts a lot of effort into his crops. This year he harvested a good quantity of coffee. Now he is putting his efforts into the cleaning of his coffee plantation. He believes it desirable to hire workers to do the cleaning of his fields, and so he needs your support to pay these people and to buy fertilizer. This is his second loan from MFP, and so he mentions that he will be punctual in making his monthly payments. "TheYanesha Producers" is his communal bank, and he feels at ease with its members.

He will invest the 1500 PEN in the purchase of 15 bags of organic fertilizer to prepare his coffee and banana plantings for the next harvest.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of organic fertilizer to prepare his coffee and banana crops for the next harvest

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en:
Run, 58, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has three children, including one who is dependent and still in school. For the last ten years, she and her husband have been farming rice as the family’s primary source of income to make a living. The current business earns her about KHR18,000 per day and she can save about KHR12,000 each day for the future needs.

Run’s group consists of two members. She is in her second loan cycle while her other group member is starting with VisionFund this loan cycle. She successfully used the first loan to better support her family’s living. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of KHR1,000,000 and KHR600,000 respectively. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for gasoline. She hopes to make more fruitful rice in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10 bags of farm bird guano.

loans.name: Otgon

texts.en: Mr.Otgon is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a little house in Tosontsengel province, Mongolia. His wife helps his business, his eldest daughter goes to the secondary school, and the younger one goes to kindergarten. He has been working as assistant in organic vegetable growing business since 2000, so he has years of experience in this area. This year, he planted organic vegetables in his brother's garden and harvested lot more than others did. Mr. Otgon is a diligent and hardworking person who says, ''I would like to buy big enough land to grow organic vegetables and expand my vegetable growing and trading business" The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000MNT to buy more seeds to plant more organic vegetables to increase his profit and get closer to reach his short term plan.

loans.use: To buy more seeds to plant more organic vegetables

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantuya is 37 years old and lives with her husband and a daughter in a small house in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her husband, Uliyanow, is 37 years old. He works as a driver for a mining company. Her daughter, Haliunaa, is 15 years old. She is a secondary school student. Mrs Narantuya moved from Ulaanbaatar city to Selenge province in 2010 with her family. 

Mrs.Narantuya has been working in clothes retail business in the black market. She is planning to open her own business in that market. She is responsible and honest person. She needs 3,900,000MNT to purchase clothes and other necessary items for her newly starting business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and other necessary items for her newly starting business

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 30 years of age. She is thankful because she has been blessed with two children. Jean does her best to meet their needs. She has been engaged in hog-raising for six years and earns approximately PHP 8,000 every four months. She says that the most tiresome part is to clean the piggery every day. She dreams to lift her family from poor living, which is why she works hard through her business. She wants also to provide the necessities needed of her pigs, therefore she has taken a loan amount P15,000 to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourished to provide higher sales at sale time, and she hopes to grow her business to secure her family living.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en: Hamzah is a second-year university student majoring in Marketing. He is applying for a 500 JOD loan from National Microfinance Bank to pay for his upcoming semester’s fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester's fees.

loans.name: Eduardo Alberto

texts.es: Eduardo Alberto de treinta y nueve años de edad vive  junto a su compañera de vida Guadalupe y sus tres hijos; él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan francés y pan dulce, como quesadillas, pastelitos, tortas, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y ha adquirido mucha experiencia en la panadería por lo que prepara el pan mas exquisito, gracias a eso obtiene siempre las mejores ganancias; El negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda en una zona muy concurrida de personas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y además por el servicio excelente; Eduardo es un hombre emprendedor, activo, dedicado a su labor y muy luchador, dia a dia busca buenas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar sus sueños y no se rendirá hasta tener el éxito que tanto se merece, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, dulce, leche, azúcar, sal, etc. Eduardo Alberto tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Eduardo Alberto, 39, lives with his life partner Guadalupe and their three children.  He works making and selling french bread and sweet bread such as "quesadillas" [corn bread with cheese], pastries, cakes, and others.  He has had the business for several years and has acquired a lot of experience in the bakery, so he makes the most delicious bread.  Thanks to this he always gets the best profits.

The business is located in his home in an area with a lot of people.  He has attracted a lot of customers, who prefer him for the quality, good prices, and excellent service.  Eduardo is an enterprising and active man, a fighter who is dedicated to his job.  Every day he looks for good opportunities that will allow him to realize his dreams, and he won't give up until he has the success he so deserves.

Demand has gone up in the past few weeks and he wants to take advantage of it to make a new investment.  This is why he's asking Integral for a loan to buy flour wholesale, jelly, milk, sugar, salt, etc.

Eduardo Alberto has a good payment record and is very responsible.  He's certain he'll be able to pay back the debt and also trusts that he'll give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale, milk, sugar, salt

loans.name: Baasanjargal

texts.en:
Baasanjargal is a 44-year-old married woman who has a son and a daughter. She has lived with her family in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia since 2008, having moved there from Darkhan province.

Baasanjargal supports her family by selling household or home furnishing goods at a local indoor market. She wants to use this Kiva loan to increase her working capital and to purchase facilities for study.

loans.use: to purchase goods for study such as books, notebooks, pencils and etc.

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en:
Sopio is from the small village of Kaspi district. She is 46 years old and lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and a grandchild. Sopio’s husband serves to the local people as a driver and her son works at security police department. Both of them get monthly income. Sopio runs a small poultry farm. She has hens and sells eggs locally. Sopio is hard working woman who is responsible and very well known in the area for her big heart and friendliness with others.

Sopio requested a loan to repair her roof. With this credit she will purchase building materials and repair it. The existing one is old and the water drops during the rainy weather. Due to the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved. Sopio hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her roof

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad, a 20 year-old single guy, is one of four brothers in his family. He is majoring in accounting. He is in his second year and would like to take this loan to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester school fees.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai is the leader of this two-member group, and this will be their first loan. Mai, 33, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district in Cambodia. She has three children who are still in school.

For the last fourteen years Mai and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava as their main source of income. They currently earn about 44,000 KHR a day.

Mai and her loan partner are applying for a 2,000,000 KHR loan with VisionFund. She will use her half of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and hire farm workers. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell them for a good price so as to improve her and her husband’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and hire farm workers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 25 years old and lives in Tulkarem in Palestine. Since 2008 he has owned a shop where he sells and repairs mobile phones.

Mohammad is applying for this 2000 USD youth loan with Ryada in order to buy more mobile phones to stock his shop. He hopes this loan will help him increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones to stock his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 20 bags of manure from barnyard fowl to spread on his coffee crops

loans.name: Chat's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in Battambang Province’s Ek Phnom District, Chat is age 57 and married with seven children, one of whom is dependent on her. For the last 35 years, Chat has been planting peanuts to make a living, while her husband is a rice farmer. Together, they can earn about 58,000 riels (KHR) per day and can save about 13,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Chat’s group consists of two members. Chat has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles, while her group member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Chat successfully used her past loans from VisionFund to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to increase her family’s income for a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 56, is married and has six children. She describes herself as a quiet woman.

Besides her work as a farmer, Mary has had a shop for the past two years where she sells detergent. Her shop is located near a busy town, and her primary customers are schools, hotels and local residents from nearby neighborhoods. A lack of enough money to improve her business is her main challenge.

Mary is applying for a 15,000 KES loan with SMEP DTM; she borrowed and successfully paid off a previous loan of 5,000 KES with SMEP. She will use the money to buy the chemicals necessary for making her detergent.

Mary’s ambition is to see her business grow and take on employees within five years.

loans.use: to buy the chemicals necessary for making her detergent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer like bird guano from farms, for his next coffee crops.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 24-year-old conservative lady, so she asked her cousin to appear in the photo instead.
 
Amani is the mother of four kids. Besides taking care of her family, she's also decided to help her cousin Ibrahim finish his education and get a bachelor's degree in engineering (that's why she has applied for this educational loan).

loans.use: to help her cousin Ibrahim finish his education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy several bags of organic fertilizers, to scatter them in her coffee and banana crops.

loans.name: Victoria De La Paz
