texts.es: Victoria de la Paz de cincuenta años de edad junto a su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada para damas, caballeros y niños,  en un puesto del mercado de la localidad donde reside, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en la venta lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; es muy conocida y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad de la ropa, los buenos precios y además por el excelente servicio; Victoria es una mujer activa, dedicada a su labor, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo porque sabe que solo así lograra su objetivo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa usada por mayor. Victoria de la Paz tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Victoria de la Paz is 50 years old. Along with her family, she sells used clothing for women, men, and children in a market stall in the place where she lives. She has had this business for a number of years, and this has given her a lot of experience in sales, which allows her to obtain better earnings. She is well known and has many customers, who prefer her because of the quality of her clothing, the good prices, and, in addition, for her excellent service. Victoria is an active woman, dedicated to her work, with a great will to advance. She is always on the lookout for new opportunities that will allow her to achieve success. Every day she strives to the maximum because she knows that only this way will she achieve her objective. In recent weeks, demand increased, and she wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment. She needs capital, and for this reason she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy used clothing wholesale. Victoria de la Paz has good payment references and is responsible. She assures that she will be able to pay off the debt, and at the same time she is confident that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy used clothing wholesale

loans.name: Tharwat

texts.en: Tharwat, a 21-year-old single lady, has 4 siblings living all together. Tharwat is a university student majoring in Managerial Information Systems. She has applied to this loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Kan's Group

texts.en:
Kan, 46, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She has six children, five of whom are dependents and still in school. The other is a farmer. Kan and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting cassava, which they both have been in for more than twenty years to make a living. The current business earns her about KHR 29,000 per day and she can save about KHR 17,000 each day for her future needs.

This is the first micro loan for Kan’s group with VisionFund. Now leading her group of two to apply for loans of KHR 1,000,000 each, Kan will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it for labor costs. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Mirtala

texts.es: Mirtala de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a sus tres hijos en casa propia; ella  posee una carnicería desde hace ya varios años, ha ganado mucha experiencia en las ventas y eso le ayuda a obtener muy buenas ganancias, comercia desde un puesto en el mercado de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque su venta es de calidad, a buenos precios y además con un servicio excelente; Mirtala es una mujer emprendedora, activa, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran camino al éxito, su mas grande secreto el amor y el esfuerzo en el trabajo; en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar carne por mayor. Mirtala tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mirtala, 51, lives with her three children in her own house.  She has had a butcher shop for several years.  She has a lot of experience in sales and this helps her get very good profits.  She sells from a stall in the town market and has a lot of customers.  People prefer her because she sells a quality product at a good price with excellent service.

Mirtala is an enterprising and active woman who is dedicated to her job and very much wants to get ahead.  She's always hoping for new opportunities that will lead her to success.  Her biggest secret is love and effort in her work.

Demand has gone up in the past few weeks and she wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment.  This is why she's asking Integral for a loan to buy meat wholesale.

Mirtala has a good payment record and impeccable moral character.  She's certain that she'll be able to repay the debt and also trusts that she'll give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meat wholesale

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: María Guadalupe de treinta y seis años de edad vive junto a sus hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos típicos como pastelitos, tamales, atol entre otros, además para complementar los gastos del hogar vende camisas de futbol los domingos; tiene varios años con el negocio y  eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia a las afueras de su vivienda y es muy conocida por todas las personas de la comunidad pues prepara los antojitos mas deliciosas de la zona, ya tiene mucha clientela fija que la prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a buen precio y sobre todo con un servicio excelente; María es una mujer activa, emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y siempre dispuesta a luchar por encontrar las mejores alternativas que le abran camino al éxito, su mas grande secreto es el esfuerzo y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así cumplirá su objetivo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INNTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, pollos, verduras, carne etc. María Guadalupe tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe, 36, lives with her children. She sells traditional dishes such as little pastries, tamales, atol (thick corn paste based drink) among others, and to supplement household expenses she sells soccer shirts on Sundays. She has been working several years in this business and this has given her a lot of experience in sales allowing her to earn the best profits. She does business outside of her home and she is well known by everyone in the community because she prepares the most delicious typical dishes in the area. She has a lot of regular customers that prefer her because everything she sells is of high quality, a good price and above all with excellent service.

Maria is an active, enterprising woman, dedicated to her work and always ready to fight to find the best alternatives that pave the way to success. Her greatest secret is her effort and love for her work and she knows that only then will she meet her target. 

In recent weeks demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of it to make a new investment but she needs capital and that is why she is requesting a loan from INNTEGRAL which will allow her to buy corn, chickens, vegetables, meat etc… Maria Guadalupe has good payment references and is very responsible. She assures that she can pay off the debt and at the same time trusts that she will give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy corn, chickens, vegetables, meat.

loans.name: Gemmalyn

texts.en:
Gemmalyn has been offering various kinds of fruit for six years. She is 33 years of age and happily married to Danilo who is also engaged in vending fruit. The couple has been blessed with three children. Two of her children are still studying while the youngest one is still an infant.

Gemmalyn plans to increase the amount of fruit that she offers, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000. She will use this loan to buy more stock of apple, grapes and lansones for her fruit vending business. She's hoping that through this fruit vending business she manages, she can send her children to a higher level of education and generate greater income.

loans.use: to buy more apples, grapes and lansones to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase fruit and vegetables to sell. This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD. 

The profit she earns will be ploughed back to her business. In the future, Beatrice hopes to open a boutique to start a new line of business alongside the current one.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en:
Phorn is aged 46 years and married with three children. Residing in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava for more than twenty years to make a living. To better support the family, her husband makes beds to sell. The current business earns her about KHR23,000 per day and she can save about KHR17,000 each day for her future needs.

Phorn’s group consists of two members and they both have been with VisionFund for two cycles. She successfully used the past loans from VisionFund to better support her standard of living. Now, she and her group, are applying for a loan of KHR1,400,000 each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy wooden boards to make beds for sale. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her current business and earn more income for the family to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en: Waleed is a 49 year old married man, supporting a family of five. He has a mini market which is their source of income. Waleed has applied to this loan to bring new type of goods and products for the store.

loans.use: to bring new type of goods and products for the store.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa de 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas, ella es muy trabajadora por lo que posee su propio negocio en el que se dedica a la venta de medicinas naturales y químicas, estas las comercializa en su casa de habitación, y debido a que no hay ninguna farmacia en los alrededores posee gran demanda, por lo que solicita un préstamo y de esta manera aprovechar al máximo esta oportunidad, ella desea comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de medicinas en diferentes marcas y precios y de esta forma llegar a un mercado más amplio con lo que cuente con más clientes. Rosa es muy puntual y responsable y cuenta con un enorme deseo de salir adelante y mejorar en la vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 44, lives with her husband and two daughters. She is a hard worker who has her own business selling natural medicines and chemicals. Rosa sells these products from her home and experiences great demand since there are no pharmacies in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting a loan so that she can make the most of this opportunity. Rosa wants to buy a large quantity and a variety of medicines that are of different brands and prices. As a result, she will be able to expand her market and attract more customers.

Rosa is very punctual and responsible. She has the drive to succeed and improve her life.

loans.use: to buy medicines to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry's hobby is baking different kinds of bread. His business location was in Mindoro but as time passed, the couple decided to stay here in Isabela to start a bakery business. Henry devotes his time to improving his baked breads to gain a better income and to become a well-known baker someday.

Henry's bakery is now two years old. He is 47 years old, married and has seven children. He would like to educate all his seven children because it's the only inheritance he can give to them. His main priority at this time is to increase the profit he gains so he can save for the bright future of his seven children. At this time, he is starting another outlet of his bakery but his capital is inadequate, so he is requesting PHP 25,000. Some of the loan will be used to buy necessary ingredients such as flour, baking soda and sugar to improve the taste and quality of the baked breads he offers. He knows that someday he could fulfill his dream in life through empowering his business and adopting new strategies in baking new bread recipes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, baking soda, and sugar and to pay for maintenance of his bakery

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Khorn, 48, is widowed. She is living in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. She has no kids to take care of. Too earn an income, she has been farming rice and planting cassava for 18 years and sometimes she works for others for a fee to gain additional income. With her hard work, she manages to earn about KHR 32,000 per day and can save about KHR 17,000 each day for her future needs.

This is the first loan for Khorn with VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan of KHR 1,500,000. She will use her loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for pesticides and labor. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Bolortuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Bolortuya is 30 years old and lives with her mother and two children in an apartment in Bulgan province, Mongolia. Her mother has retired. Her two children, Bat-Undrah and Naransolongo, are aged five. They are starting kindergarten.

Mrs. Bolortuya is starting a clothes and other products retail business on a rental counter in a shopping center this month, with her sister. She is planning to expand her new business further on and increase working capital. She is a hardworking and honest person. She is requesting 1,800,000 MNT of loan to purchase inventory and other additional products.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and other additional products.

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en: Ret, a citizen from Kandal Stoeung district of Cambodia, is 58 years old and has four children. To secure her family's basic needs, she does rice cultivation and vegetable growing. She has been engaged in this business for 28 years. Including this cycle, she is a six-time borrower and her co-member is a first-time borrower. She uplifted her lifestyle with her past loan which she has completely repaid. Besides running a business, her family's hygienic practice is also important. For that reason, she formed a group of two to seek a latrine loan in amount of 160,000 KHR each. For Ret, as group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy below-the-ground items (tanks, cement, pipe..etc) for decent latrine construction. She hopes that this new latrine will benefit her children for good health.

loans.use: to buy below-the-ground items for latrine construction.

loans.name: Harly

texts.en: Harly, 47, is married and blessed with four children. His main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. He has 20 years of experience. With his last crop, he earned about 35,000 PHP. Now, he is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings and pay the labor cost for planting his farm. Future loans from Kiva would be very useful to him, as he sees the loans as the only chance for the growth of his business and financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings and pay the labor cost for planting his farm.

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel is 30 years old and married.

Lucel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy such goods as groceries, food items and personal care products to sell.

Lucel has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lucel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products (grocery, food items, etc.) to sell

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es: María Consuelo de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Hernán y sus tres hijos; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, granos básicos, leche, pan, jabones, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, la tienda esta ubicada en su vivienda en una comunidad muy transitada de personas , ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque es la tienda mas surtida con productos de calidad, a muy buenos precios y además con un servicio excelente; María es una mujer emprendedora, activa, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidad que le abran camino al éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio pero necesita realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. María Consuelo tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Consuelo, 39, lives with her life partner Hernán and her three children.  She has a store where she sells necessities, basic grains, milk, bread, and soap, among other things.  She has had the business for several years and has a lot of experience in sales, which allows her to earn the best profit.  The store is located in her home in a buy community.  She has a lot of customer.  People prefer her because her store is stocked with quality products at good prices, and she also has excellent service.


María is an enterprising and active woman who is dedicated to her job and very much wants to get ahead.  She's always hoping for new opportunities that will put her on the road to success.

Like any good merchant she wants to grow her business.  She needs a new investment, though, so she's asking Integral for a loan to buy basic grains, candy, instant food, beverages, soap, etc.

María Consuelo has a good payment record and is very responsible.  She's certain that she'll be able to repay the debt and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, instant food, beverages, and soap

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is a 48-year-old married man from Marka, Jordan. He has six children and works as a painter. Bassam has requested a 500 JOD loan to buy the tools he need in his work as a painter. In the future, Bassam wishes he could buy a home and open his own shop.

loans.use: to buy tools for painting

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with a thatched wall in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Sor is 42 years old and married with two dependent children who are still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and raising pigs. The current business earns her about KHR 76,000 per day and she can save about KHR 35,000 each day for their future needs. 

Sor has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she successfully repaid the loan, which has helped her better support her family’s living. Now requesting another loan of KHR 2,000,000, she is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy more piglets. She hopes to grow her current business to increase her family’s income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona, 35, is married and has three children. Her husband is a blacksmith. To help her husband pay the household bills and to improve their living conditions, she started a small home business selling clothes and children’s bed covers. She has applied for this loan to increase the quantity of goods she has available to sell to increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of clothes and children's bed covers.

loans.name: Vansin's Group

texts.en:
Vansin, 59, is a widow who lives in a rural village of Banteay Meanchey province’s Mongkol Borey district. Vansin earns a living by raising pigs and it is the family’s main source of income. She has three children and one of them is still in school. Having been in this business for 34 years, she can earn about KHR 26,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 per day for future needs. The main challenge for her family is the lack of capital to support her business and to support her daughter’s education. 

Vansin’s group consists of three female members. She has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already and the other members have been with VisionFund for two cycles. She successfully used the past loans to increase her family’s living standard. Now leading her group to apply for another loan, she will use her portion to buy pig feed for her business and use a portion of it to buy yeast for a seeding business. She hopes this loan will enable her to raise her pigs to be fat and healthy and also start up another business to increase her family’s income to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pig business.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Atyrbu

texts.ru:
Атырбу – лидер группы «Озгоруш», включающую еще 2 участниц. Ей 48 лет, вдова, имеет 5 детей. Атырбу в советское время проработала табачницей, и после распада Союза в качестве основного дохода начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, стартовав с суммы 15,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Атырбу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 дойные коровы в приплодом, 3,28 га орошаемой земли с картофелем и фасолью, ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 7,000 сом. Также, Атырбу в качестве непостоянного дохода занимается пошивом национальных изделий – тошоков (одеяла), сидушек и т.д. Доходы от бизнеса позволяют Атырбу оплачивать обучение сына и дочери, находящихся в столице.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Атырбу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Атырбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Atyrbu is the leader of the Ozgorush group, which consists of a total of three members [Ozgorush is the name of her village].  Atyrbu is a 48-year-old widow with five children.  During Soviet times, she used to work as a tobacconist.  After the fall of the Soviet Union, she started to get involved in animal-husbandry and agriculture as her main source of income, starting with an initial capital of 15,000 som (KGS).

Through hard work, Atyrbu has managed to develop her business: she now owns three dairy cows and their offspring and she cultivates 3.28 hectares (8.1 acres) of irrigated land on which she grows potatoes and beans.  From this business, she makes close to 7,000 som (KGS) per month.

As an additional source of income, Artybu also sews traditional national items such as toshoks (blankets), seat cushions etc...  With her income, she is able to pay tuition fees for her son and daughter who currently reside in the capital city.

In order to further develop her business, she has turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy young bulls for fattening and resale.  She plans to invest her earnings from this loan into further increasing her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Ton's Group

texts.en:
Ton is a resident from a rural area located in Kror Kro district, Cambodia. He has two children who are still in school. To maintain his household, he has been farming rice and raising pigs for 18 years. The current business earns him for almost 17,000 KHR. 

Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) before, Ton formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. He is applying for 1,000,000 KHR while his co-member is seeking 1,400,000 KHR. As group leader, he will use his portion to buy more piglets for raising. He hopes that he can increase the income of his current business and keep up good progress in his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Yasmien

texts.en:
Yasmien is a 28-year-old married female from Jubaiha in Jordan. She has two children and has requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and for buying furniture. She wants to buy some furniture and a bedroom set for her kids.

Since Yasmien is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en: Kunthea is 33 years old and single. She is a rural villager from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been tailoring clothes for 10 years and is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day. Kunthea, a fourth-cycle loan client, has joined a group with a six-cycle loan member to seek a new loan with VisionFund. Her past loan, which she has fully paid back, has helped to better support her household and her business gradually. Now, she and her group member are each requesting 200,000 KHR. As a group leader, she is going to use a portion of her loan to buy sandy soil to fill the ditch surrounding her house. In addition, a small portion of it will be used to purchase sewing materials for her business. She believes that this purchase will help her to overcome difficulties during the rainy season and support her business.

loans.use: To buy sandy soil to fill the ditch surrounding her house

loans.name: Suon's Group

texts.en: Suon, a 29-year-old mother of two schoolchildren, is a rice farmer residing in the Sangke district of Battambang Province. Besides helping in the rice field, her husband provides rice-threshing services for a fee. She has been engaged in this business for eight years. Suon's group consists of two members and both of them have been with VisionFund at least for two cycles. Suon, a third-time borrower including this loan, has used her loans with success to move her family's living condition forward. In addition, all of her loans have been repaid. Now she is seeking 1,200,000 KHR and her fellow group member is applying for 500,000 KHR. As a group leader, her loan portion will be used to buy fertilizer for her cash crop. She hopes that this purchase will increase her productivity so she can maintain her household.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cash crop

loans.name: Kuña Aty Villa De Pescadores Villa Paso 3 Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre kuña Aty Villa de Pescadores Villa Paso 3 ahora se  inician en el 3er ciclo, y cuentan que el grupo les ha ayudado mucho a salir adelante y a ayudar a sus familias, son mujeres muy luchadoras que desean salir adelante y ayudar a los suyos.
La señora Lorens quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, es parte de este grupo, y cuenta que se esfuerza mucho siempre por salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo ayudar a sus familiares a que tengan todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Lorens solicita el préstamo para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, en especial prendas de verano, ya que se acerca el tiempo del calor  y quiere tener buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women's communal bank called Kuña Aty Villa de Pescadores Villa Paso 3 is beginning its third loan cycle.  They say the group has helped them a lot to get ahead and help their families.  They're women who strive to get ahead and help their loved ones.

Lorens, who makes a living selling clothing, is part of this group and she says that she always works hard to get ahead.  With her job she helps her family members have everything they need to have a life of dignity without deprivation.

She's requesting the loan to buy all types of clothing, especially for summer because the hot weather is coming and she wants to have a good variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en: Mervat is a 38-year-old married woman. She is a mother one one child. Her husband is a carpenter. Mervat has applied for this loan to support her home retail business by procuring more perfumes and cosmetic products to increase her profits.

loans.use: To procure more perfume and cosmetic products

loans.name: Razelda

texts.en:
Razelda works hard to support her family. Razelda is married and has a buying and selling rice grains business in the Philippines.

Razelda requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Razelda has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Razelda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Jumabu

texts.ru:
Жумабу 64 года, воспитала 2 детей. После развала Союза, Жумабу в качестве основного дохода начала занимается животноводством и полеводством, стратовав этот бизнес с суммы 4,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Жумабу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  9 дойных коров, 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 10,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жумабу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Жумабу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и  увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Jumabu is 64 years old and has raised two children.  After the fall of the Soviet Union, she got involved in animal husbandry and agriculture as a main source of income, starting in this business with an initial capital of 4,000 som (KGS).

Through hard work, she was able to develop her business and she now owns nine dairy cows and ten head of smaller livestock.  From this business, she makes a monthly income of close to 10,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Jumabu has turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of  50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy livestock for fattening and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing her livestock headcount and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: An inhabitant residing in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang (Cambodia), Sokhom is a 59-year-old mother with eight children. Seven of her children are in the local public school in the community. Like her neighbors, she and her husband do rice cropping, the only business that she has done for 30 years, in order to provide their daily basic needs. Two loans ago was her first loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She has succeeded in securing decent food for her family via her past loan, which she paid back completely. Now, she is in a group of two. Her co-member is on her fourth loan. She is seeking 500,000 KHR and her co-member is applying for 200,000 KHR. As a leader, she is going to buy wire to connect the electronic supply to her house. She hopes that this purchase will help her to have electricity for her children's sake as it enables them to read books longer during nighttime than using candle light or electronic light supplied by a charger.

loans.use: To buy wire for connecting the electronic supply

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña guapa es el grupo formado por 16 señoras muy trabajadoras. La señora Elisa es la integrante que formo el grupo, ella tiene 51 años es una persona muy activa que trabaja para su familia, el grupo y por su comunidad; realiza trabajos de cotillón y costura en general y es gracias a todo esto que está saliendo adelante y ayuda a los suyos. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, con lo que podrá hacer las prendas que recibe como pedido.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y su grupo están recibiendo, ya que podrán seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Kuña Guapa is a group made up of 16 very hardworking women.  Elisa is the member who started the group.  She's 51 years old and a very active person who works for her family, the group, and her community.  She does party supplies and general tailoring, and it's thanks to all this that she's getting ahead and helping her loved ones.

She's requesting the loan to buy fabric to be able to make garments that have been ordered.

She's grateful for the opportunity that she and her group are receiving because they'll be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru:
Рачабали родился в 1959 году. Он проживает в городе Вахдат. Рачабали живет с женой. У него трое детей. 
Рачабали более шести лет занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Раньше он работал фермером. Рачабали разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области он имеет богатый опыт. Рачабали берет кредит для закупа нескольких голов бычков и двух коров.
texts.en:
Rajabali was born in 1959.  He lives with his wife in the city of Vahdat.  They have three children.

Rajabali has been involved in animal husbandry for more than six years, raising cows at home.  He used to work as a farmer.  He now raises cattle for resale and is very experienced in this field.

He is taking a loan to buy a few young bulls and two cows.

loans.use: to buy a few young bulls and two cows.

loans.name: Sokney's Group

texts.en: A 30-year-old mother of five schoolchildren, Sokney is a rural resident from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. Her main source of income is from growing corn on two hectares of farmland. Her husband helps to generate more income by working for others for a fee. Engaging in this business for 30 years, she is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day. However, sometime her crop output is low due to pests. To overcome this challenge, she formed a group of two to seek a new loan. Her past loan has provided her a decent income from her current business and provided her with sufficient daily food. Now she and her co-member are seeking 400,000 KHR and 300,000 KHR, respectively. She, the group leader, is going to use her portion to buy pesticide for her farmland. She hopes that this purchase will minimize her losses due to insects and return a good yield so she can make more profit for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Tsiala

texts.en:
Tsiala is from the village of Dighomi. She is 55 years old and lives with her husband and two children. Her son works as a security guard and her daughter is a kindergarten teacher. Both of them receive a monthly salary. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they run a small dairy farm with a milk cow and produce yogurt, which is sold at the local supermarkets. In addition, they have 60 sheep and Tsiala’s husband shepherds them to the mountains to increase their productivity. The family sells lambs and sheep periodically. In addition, Tsiala has a large greenhouse and sows beet greens during the winter season and cucumbers in the summer. She does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest.

With the requested loan, Tsiala will purchase wood to heat the greenhouse during the winter season. After the wood is purchased, Tsiala will be able to protect her plants during cold weather and get a good harvest. She will sell more beet greens and this will increase the family's income. The profit will be reinvested in the family's agricultural activities. Tsiala hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase wood to heat her greenhouse

loans.name: Muhibjon

texts.ru: Мухибджону 19 лет. Он молодой, энергичный и приятный молодой человек. Мухибджон с отличными оценками окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса по специальности экономиста. Среди однокурсников Мухибджон уже имеет хороший статус и уважение. Он очень любит читать зарубежную литературу. В свободное время он занимается спортом. Особенно он играет футбол. Мухибджон еще не женился и живет с родителями. Зарплата его родителей не хватает оплатить за учебу в университете и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 550 долларов США. Он надеется на вашу доброту. Давайте, ему поможем стать экономистом и таким образом осуществить его заветную мечту!
texts.en:
Muhibjon is 19 years old.  He is a dynamic and pleasant young man who graduated from high school with excellent grades.  He is now enrolled at the Tajik State University of Law, Business and Politics, majoring in economics.

Muhibjon has already achieved good status and respect among his classmates.  He also has a passion for foreign literature.  In his spare time, he enjoys sports, particularly soccer.

Muhibjon is still single.  He lives with his parents, whose salary is not sufficient to pay for his college tuition.  This is why he is requesting a loan of 550 USD.

Muhibjon is counting on your kindness.  Let's make his dream come true and let's help him to become an economist!

loans.use: to pay his tuition

loans.name: Teodora

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 	
É docente há bastante tempo e quadro do Ministério da Educação. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, ferro, chapas, barrotes e outros) para a construção de um estabelecimento comercial PARA INICIAR NEGOCIO DE VENDA DE PRODUTOS DIVERSOS, SEM TER QUE ALUGAR.
No futuro deseja adquirir um meio de transporte para facilitar nas deslocações para o local de trabalho, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é fazer crescer o negócio de forma a concretizar os projectos.
texts.en:
Teodora is married and a mother to two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house with her family and also provides for two nephews  who live with her.
She has been a teacher for a long time and is a staff member at the Ministry of Education.
With this loan she intends to buy construction materials (sand, cement, iron, plates, beams and others) for the construction of a commercial building, so that she can build a store to sell from, without having to rent.
In the future she wishes to purchase a means of transport to aid in her commute. For this, she is committing to repay the loan, in order to request more from Hluvuku.
The challenge is to grow the business in a way that will help her carry out her projects.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, cement, iron, plates, beams and others) for the construction of a commercial building.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is a heavy pineapple-producing region. She has 5 children and has been doing this work for 15 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, transportation services, employer pension, personal business. She will use the loan amount to buy a chuff-cutter which will ease the feeding of animals.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Income.!" Her biggest challenge is "Cutting nappier grass with a panga". The animal in the farm is named "Brown".

Nancy was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Because they buy asset for smallscale farmers."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Loan must be paid and savings must be done."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?", Nancy replied "Will reduce workload. Therefore there will be more time to do other jobs."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Nancy owns the following: a cow, pig, poultry, and an automobile,  but does not own a pump, bicycle, or motorcycle. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, and DVD, but does not have solar power, or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a chuff-cutter

loans.use: To buy a water tank
